text:
I've lived in Charlotte over a decade - I can't believe it either - and lived all over the city. The one constant is that I'll schlep from anywhere in the city to Montford for the Roasting Company.

For me, it's the Tico sauce, not so much the Jaco sauce. I have to have some Tico black beans with extra Tico at least once a week. I just keep forgetting to go on Fridays when they have stewed okra and tomatoes. Darnit!

And I agree with the other poster who mentioned just how many restaurants have come and gone on Montford over the years. The Roasting Company still remains.

Great place for a quick and local lunch. The chicken is moist, juicy and tender. The half chicken is a fantastic deal, for the extra $2 you are rewarded with 50% more meat. The sauce counter is full of spicy surprises. Overall a great local lunch joint - the kind of place you will like introducing to your friends.

this place is really going down hill fast....been eating there since they opened and not only is the food now lacking but the service is just flat out bad. Called an order to go today and made 3 stops prior in about 30 minutes and still had to wait on my food. A few weeks ago they completely missed one of our dinners on a take-out order as well.  Such a shame

It so disappointing when a great place goes under new management and everything people love about it changes.
When I heard Jake wasn't there anymore I couldn't believe it. Perhaps it's all coincidence or the new manager has something to do with it. But by the looks of it they have taken a hit in business, go figure since the atmosphere has completely changed. This place also seems less friendly to Montford, they now only do food until 1:30, and close at 12 Sun-Wed. They only offer  a limited menu after 10, and they no longer provide table service. Drink specials seem to have stayed the same but for all you beer lovers, the draft lineup is never switched up anymore, huge downfall.
My husband and I were maybe not frequent enough to call regulars but were in there at least 3 times per month (enough as to where Jake and Danielle knew us by name). It was a little treat to go to The Roasting Co., get a drink and dinner, get recommendations on places in Charlote with good food. Now we like to go to Moosehead down the street.
Also, they are lucky ALE hasn't hit them yet considering the new manager drinks at the bar out in the open during work (very unprofessional).
We'll be getting all togo from here on out.

I walked away from the Roasting Company, after my first visit, with a big smile and wallet in tacked.  I had a 1/4 roasted chicken (dark meat) with collards, white bean stew and a cornbread muffin for 6.99 with tax.

The chicken was tasty, although I could see where their white meat may sometimes be a little dry.  The highlight was the white bean stew which is their veggie of the day on Thursday's.  It may be a while before I work up another appetite but when I do you will be able to find me at the Roasting Company.

The best place in Charlotte for a good, cheap, filling meal (especially to-go). You can't go wrong with the quarter chicken (white meat), two vegetables and the included corn bread. We pick up dinner here about once a week and both my wife and I can get more than enough for about $11 total.

My wife and I love this place.  I think we eat here about once a week.  The food is excellent and we feel like we're "eating healthy" (if we order the right dishes, of course) even while eating out.  I would classify it as "southern style" cuisine with dishes like pulled pork, chicken on the bone, and sides like collard greens (and a ton of others).  The chicken is phenomenal.  Always perfectly cooked.
The bar at this place is great!  A little on the small side with only a handful of stools but the beer selection is excellent.  This is a full bar with wine and mixed drinks as well.  The parking can be a bit of a pain but that is true for every business on Montford St.  It's actually better than most places on Montford St.
The few times I've used the salsa bar it's been a bit of a mess.  They could do better to keep that station clean and stocked.
If you are in the mood for some good chicken, pork, and a bunch of excellent side choices, try this place out.  You won't regret it!

Decent lunch place for a quick and easy meal. Chicken is good and well plated. An array of side dishes available to suit all customers. Pricing is fair and inexpensive. A no frills chicken joint that's all about the chicken!

I came here for lunch with colleagues during the recent Teacher Workdays. I wasn't overly impressed. I ordered the chicken salad on a roll with a side of baked beans, and it was just nothing special. I usually like to go to lunch and be waited on, but we were in a hurry and a colleague suggested The Roasting Company. I have never been here, so I thought, what the heck,I'll try it. I figured it was pretty popular when we walked up to the restaurant and the line was almost out the door. The chicken salad was bland and the only thing I was really able to taste were  the walnuts added to it. The baked beans were too spicy and there was a jalapeño pepper sliced and mixed in with the beans. Overall, not impressed and wouldn't return.

Loved my experience here! The chicken was delicious. They catered to my indecisiveness and I was able to get half white meat/half dark. With a double order of veggies, I was able to find a paleo-friendly meal at a great price! 

I went on Thursday and they had good wine specials and an awesome trivia concept called "Not your Boyfriends Trivia." All questions were geared towards females and it was so entertaining! 

Chicken. Wine. Trivia. I don't think I could ask for anything better!
Squash casserole is the best! Love the chicken too! My new favorite fast food that doesn't taste fast :) try them !

The food was great.  I had a 1/2 chicken with Okra and tomatoes and squash casserole.  My date had 1/4 chicken white with cornbread dressing and slaw.  If was generous portions and the tab was $20 which is incredible!
Love this place! It has delicious food made from scratch and the service is fast. I especially love the pork. And they have cider on tap which I favor over beer. I also enjoy the patio on warm days.

When I worked in this area, I used to eat lunch here once every week. They have a good variety of roased chicken dishes and the food comes with some delicious spicy cornbread muffins. The chicken is delicious but don't sleep on the jaco pork which has a hard to describe BBQ-like sauce. I think the pork stands up to it better than chicken could. Then kick it up with some of their hot sauce. 

The sides are also quite good. I usually stick with the collards but there's plenty to choose from. I usually get my grub on for around $7. Man, talking about it makes me wish I still worked near there.

Okay so it was my friend's idea to go here. Honestly if I had checked it out online first I probably wouldn't have gone. In reality the food is lacking flavor. I mean, it's good but it could use some more flavors as far as seasoning the chicken. Seriously. I had the chicken salad sandwich and it was super bland in my mouth. Couldn't finish it. I also had mac and cheese which was okay but I was confused why they labeled it spicy when there was not a twinge of spicy lol. I tasted my friend's veggies, and they just weren't very flavorful. I guess if you are on a low sodium diet, or you just like plain food you should go here. I mean, I wanted to like it, but I couldn't get past the lack of seasoning. If you all are gonna do an arroz con pollo you need to add some flavor. (tasted that too). I need yall to spice up your life @theroastingcompany lol

Good food but lately poor execution.  I usually order the Monterey chicken wrap.  The first time I ordered it I had to learn the hard way that by "peppers" on the menu description they mean jalapeño peppers (not bell peppers which I assumed).  Well the following two times Ive ordered this I ask for no jalapeño peppers.  They add it anyway.  Lastnight I bit into something hard TWICE.  Two 2" chicken rib bones.  Come on man.  Im done with this place.

The roasting company is just good... no two ways about it.  It is a mix of Tex Mex, Southern, Jamaican, and everything else.  No real way to classify it.  The chicken tastes kinda like the rotisserie places in Queens, the ones where you buy the entire chicken and take it home.  

The chicken is flavorful, the cornbread dressing is a little spicy, the wraps are awesome and the prices are just right.  Great when its cold out an you want to warm up for lunch.  Definitely a hearty meal.  I never care about decor, but if you are into a comfy atmosphere, this place might not be for you.  I could care less, all about food for this big girl.  

TIp, the lines are really, really long around lunch time.  If you aren't eating in, call in your order and bypass the line by going to the call ahead counter.  The line goes into the parking lot some days and it can be hard to find a table.

We absolutely loved this place. The chicken and black bean con queso is to die for. We enjoyed it so much we went back the next day to try something different. The quality of the chicken is some of the best I've seen. Can't wait to go back to Charlotte to eat there again.

This was such a nice surprise! We have gone to this restaurnat a few ties now, and it always delivers. The chicken is melt in your mouth good! And the squash caserole out of this world. My daughter always has the jerk pork sandwich...and that does not disappoint either. And the pricing is very reasonable! From what I hear, you can order whole chickens to take home, too; although we haven't done that yet. If you like chicken, you can't go wrong ordering 1/4 or 1/2 with 2 sides. The new potatoes are great, and my daughter likes the cinnamon apples.

Go here now. Squash casserole is CRAZY. The chicken queso dish is fabulous. I've had a hard time finding something I don't love here. Everything tastes so fresh and fast service. Big portions as well.
Eat Drink RoCo! !! Great Food and atmosphere! !! Love it!## The chicken was excellent and the sides Great!!! Our plates where clean!!!
Food is good but service is terrible. They are only friendly to customers they know. Others are ignored for a long time before being attended to

I just love this place.  I have been eating here since 1995 and only wish that I lived closer so I could get here a couple of times per week.  I used to work a block away and did just that, but now it is probably once every couple of weeks.

My usual is 1/4 white, apples, and white beans au gratin, but I love the chicken and rice too.  The Roasting Company shows that good food, at a good value, served quickly will always find a happy market and they do a big business.  Nobody comes here for the parking, or the atmosphere--it is the yummy food.

For what they do, they do it really well.  Great eat n run kind of place.  Parking can be a challenge, but it's not the size of their lot, it's the quantity of people heading there for a midday meal.

Their claim to fame is their rotisserie chicken - they serve it in a variety of ways...... in a tortilla with rice and beans, over a salad, smothered in queso, with mayo in a chicken salad, etc.  I haven't had a bad chicken dish yet.  Portions are on the above-avg side.

They also have daily specials......CPP on Wednesdays is a solid choice, but my go-to special is the Meatloaf on Fridays.

Probably my favorite part of their menu is their side dishes.....squash casserole, mashed sweet potatoes, black beans, garlicky new potatoes, etc.  You can just order the veggie plate and walk out extremely satisfied.

Service is fast.....order at the counter, then they call your name to pick it up in a few minutes (sometimes your order is up before you finish paying).  

Nothing fancy about the decor, but it works.

Love the atmosphere. Casual but cool, clean and up to date. Great for families or groups. My daughter and I shared the 10 wings which was just enough for our lite appetites. My husband had the marinated grilled chicken breast sandwich. It came with mayo, cheese, lettuce and tomato. He had the squash casserole for his side. He described it as good. My 9 year old son had the chicken taco kids meal with a side of chips and queso dip. The taco would have been enough for him. There was enough chips and queso that we all had a share and still had some to bring with us.
Wow this place is excellent! New to the area and checked this place out recently. People in the other reviews aren't kidding about their sauce and the squash casserole!

I'm not 100% sure what the hype is about. The Roasting Company kind of falls under the "comfort food" category for me, but I've certainly had better comfort food in Charlotte. Admittedly, I didn't actually order any chicken. My pulled pork was pretty bland, even with the Jaco sauce on it. I had a side of mac and cheese, which was on par with any other mac and cheese out there. The highlight of my meal was the collard greens - well seasoned and tender. 

My group and I had a hard time finding a clean table. The restrooms were also a little dingy. I realize this is not an upscale establishment, but the place felt a bit grimy. 

While my experience was fairly mediocre, I can definitely see this being a great place to get drunk food in the middle of the night.

I used to frequent this place several years ago at lunch time and thought I would stop in for take out since I was in the area yesterday!  Well, I seriously have had better chicken from a can.  YUCK! I got the Chicken on rice with Queso, the Queso was like water, the texture of the chicken was just weird.  The Squash casserole was okay, but not great.  I remember I used to love the smoked pasta salad, well it had a strong vinegar flavor that I do not remember.  Most of my 9$ lunch ended up in the trash.

Roasting Company is pretty good. Good value for the amount of food you get. I usually get the 1/4th chicken and it comes with cornbread and two sides. Cinnamon apples are a must.

Guy at the register is a bit eccentric and makes you feel slightly uncomfortable, but he is extremely nice and on point.
I enjoyed the food I had the cinnamon apples with the Monterey Jack Chicken Wrap. The staff was very friendly.

Date night with my sis at the bar.  Dinner and drinks on a Thursday evening.  Not packed, pleasant company from Jake the bartender and apparently a few locals who helped us pick our meals.  I went with the pork, which was very tasty.  My highlight was squash casserole.  Sooo good - I actually went home and attempted my own version which tasty, but not nearly as good.  Green beans could've used a bit more salt.  I ordered wings to go and they smelled heavenly, but my kids devoured them before I could try them and confirm if they're finger-licking.  I'll just assume yes. 
I did not know they were hiding a salsa station around the corner (where I think the take out is?).  Yup, that's the icing on the cake!  Or in this case, the salsa on the everything :)
Bathrooms were clean, music not too loud, full bar, local brews, service was on point.  Parking lot was full, but i easily found a spot on the street. Prices were fair and Ill be back for more of everything.

This place has been a staple in south Charlotte for somewhere close to 15 years now, and they're still kickin'. 

Rotisserie style chicken (moist and fresh, and seasoned perfectly) meets a kinda southwestern meets southern comfort food equals deliciousness. They offer a few rice and black bean plates, with or without queso. Also offered are a variety of vegetable side items, with daily specials- my favorite being the squash casserole. The collard greens are great too, as well as the smoked cheese and pasta salad.

Regardless of whAt you get, the portions are always generous and I find myself with leftovers for either a snack or dinner. 

Check out the jaco and tico sauces. They also have a salsa bar inside.
Good menu. Veggies, tacos, queso and chips are excellent. Used to love the chicken and queso over rice. The last couple of times the chicken was dry and they were stingy with the queso.
Hidden gem on Montford dr. near Park Rd. Shopping Center. The Chicken is great, the sides are fantastic, the queso dip is the best I have had !

(Note, I've only been here once, but plan on going back...so this is a preliminary review!)

After several co-workers told me to give Roasting Company a try, I went in tonight on my dinner break, and wasn't disappointed!  

I had the  dark, with a side of their black beans and squash casserole.  (Though Wednesdays is famous for their Chicken Pot Pie...which I told myself I'd have next time, for sure.) Not only did the food come out quickly, it was pretty cheap, I think about $7 with tax total.  

The entrée came with a really nice piece of cornbread--moist and warm and slightly sweet.  It was wrapped in foil, I presume to keep the moistness.  Nice idea.  The beans were nicely seasoned, as was the chicken.  The chicken is definitely delicious, with a nice, crispy skin.  Waaaay better than a Boston Market chicken. 

But the star?

By far the squash casserole.  I know, connoisseurs of squash casserole will say "Dion!  This yellow mush doesn't count!  Where is the squash!?" because it really is more like stuffing, and mushy.  My co-worker, Devon and I were musing over what could be in it...we deducted butter and onions and breadcrumbs.  How can you not love it?

I particularly enjoyed the salsa bar, and the vinegar-y sliced white onions you can pile on your plate.  

The only thing that bothered me, was the crazy number of tables that weren't cleared off.  Plates with crusty remnants of food, dried on them.  There must have been 10 tables with dirty plates and half-eaten food on them.  The bathroom also featured clogged up toilets. 
Going on the food alone, I give this place 4 stars.  The selection is pretty good--with sides changing every day, and specials, like the pot pie on Wednesdays. 

 The prices are very reasonable, and the food comes out in about 5 minutes, if even.  A great alternative to fast-food...though they're going to have to work on keeping the place looking clean/nice.  

PS:  I like how they mark "heart healthy" choices with a star.  Nice touch.

I had not been here for over 15 years due to a relocation. I stopped in last week and it was like I never left. The food is absolutely delicious and the people are as nice as you can find. Best selection of sides, only complaint is I could not choose one so I had to choose 3 !!!!! Best Roasted Chicken I have ever eaten. Favorite sides are smoked cheese pasta and dil potation salad.  
Highly recommend, you will not be disapointed.

My coworker introduced me to the Roasting Company and I'm really glad about it. This place is awesome. It's great for a decent lunch or dinner. The food is tasty and the selection of sides is impressive. It's relatively cheap, as you will pay under $10 per meal/person. The workers are friendly and service is fast. Hooray for Roasting Company!!   :)

WOW! The wife ordered the chicken and black bean combo con queso and I got the sante fe chili and rice. We also ordered and split 10 hot wings. The chicken and black bean combo con queso is boneless, skinless rotisserie chicken served over our herb rice and topped with queso which I have to say after tasting it my wife threatened to stab me with her fork if I tried to get anymore. The sante fe chili and rice was homemade beef chili served over rice and topped with our queso sauce. Man this stuff was stick to your ribs goodness. The wings were the type we loved which had a crispness to them and the sauce was divine. They have other sauces there to try which are also very yummy. We had a wonderful time there and will most definitely be back.

Normally like the chicken queso on rice.  Today's was runny cheese on rice.

Get it together please.

When I lived nearby, I would eat here at least once a week.  You can't go wrong here.  The menu is centered on roasted chicken.   You can get it with Jaco sauce, black beans, whole chicken etc.  They have a large variety of sides that are just as good as the entrees.  It is a very fast-order at the counter type of place.  It is cheap, filling, and very tasty.

Still working the kinks out.  I went for the first time to this location after years of going to the one on Montford.  I called in and to my surprise it wasn't ready when I got there 25 minutes later.  Not to mention my order want even started.  When I did get my order it wasn't correct.  Hopefully they get their act together because it's a great space.

You know your meal is gonna be good when you can little smell deliciousness from the parking lot!

We decided to check out Roasting Company last night. It is right around the corner from our neighborhood and I can't believe we have never been here before!! You walk up to the ordering area, order, then wait for them to call your name. They have a seating area and a full bar. 

On the recommendations of another Yelpers review (thanks Marco!), we ordered the Chicken and Black Bean con Queso. This came with two sides and we got the collard greens and squash casserole. We also added on a side of potatoes. There were so many yummy sounding sides on the menu that it was hard to choose! 

We grabbed a seat at the bar and ordered a beer, while waiting for our food. The Triple C Baby Maker was on special for $3.50, which is an incredible deal! As this is one of my favs, beer wise, the choice was obvious! 

The food came out and was definitely plenty for two people! The squash casserole was by far the winner!! The chicken and black beans con queso was a nice portion and consisted of rice, black beans, chicken, a bbq like sauce, and cheese all chopped up. 

Definitely want to come back as they have daily specials for main courses and sides....mac n cheese, chicken pot pie, and chicken and dumplings were definitely some of the specials I want to return for!

This is my favorite place in the area.  It's my go to on the week days, weekend, and for my birthday.  

Friendly faces, late night food, the daily specials - ALWAYS worth eating.  Don't forget the sides, they're all to die for.  

Favorites:  Chicken Pot Pie, Cheesy Grits, Cornbread and Chili Tacos.

So much space, good for big parties, and if the line looks long, it goes quick.

LASTLY - get all the wings, taste them all.  They take longer, but only because they are delish.

Everything on the menu sounded delicious and I couldn't decide what to order. I ended up with enough food for five people just for me. Perfectly seasoned food and the portions were enough for left overs. Looking forward to going back.

I love the big salads and the chicken and some of the vegetables. Great place to eat when you can't decide what you want to eat.

There is a separate bar area where you can order a drink but you better be willing to wait. The bartender has totally ignored me on two visits. I had to get my son to order my drink! Not sure whats up with the bar area but that is the reason for only 3 stars.
The roasting company is great, one of my favorite local spots for dining in or take out.

My favorite thing to get at the Roasting Company ...by far ...is their Chicken Pot Pie, they only make it on Wednesdays, and you might want to call in and order yours before noon, because they tend to run out pretty quick.  The chicken pot pie is amazing.  The crust is moist doughy and flaky with a unique spice flavor, and the chicken is tender and delicious.  I have had their wings as well as some regular orders of the chicken and all of those things are decent, but the one thing you must get here is the Chicken Pot Pie.

If it were possible to give less than one star I would. My husband and I ordered the Jacko pork with rice and sides. The pork was bland and the portion was less than a kid's portion. The veggies were also bland. I will never patronize this restaurant again. It is extremely disappointing to pay for food and get so little. I don't understand why this restaurant has a four star rating. The food is mediocre at best, I'm being kind.

I honestly don't get what the big deal is with this place... 

I've eaten here 2 - 3 times with coworkers who rave about it but it seems to me that its just a confused Boston market with lower quality food.

Yum, yum, yum!  I wasn't even sure this place was open when I drove by it the first 1000 times but we finally decided to go in and give it a shot while getting the oil changed down the street.  Well worth it!  I had the rotisserie chicken sandwich and it was a MOUND of chicken with thier special jaco sauce on a bun with lettuce and tomato.  Definitely plenty...I couldn't eat it all.  The jaco sauce...which I was told contained soy, pineapple juice, honey, and worchestire sauce....tasted more like watered down soy all by itself.  It was so salty!  For my side, I had cheese grits and they were creamy, delicious, and a little spicy thanks to what I think were some green chiles.  All in all, good stuff, but next time, I will get the sauce on the side.  Oh!  For vegetarians, this is a dream....they have at least 10 veggies on their side menu, plus specials of the day.  Veggie plates all around!

I have been searching for a proper chicken pot pie since the weather got colder & saw here on Yelp that the Roasting Co had chicken pot pies on Wednesdays.  Clearly, I had to check it out.  I did get it to go, so I can't say much on the restaurant itself, other than it's surprisingly roomy inside.  

Their chicken pot pies don't mess around.  The thing is massive!   It's chock full of veggies & perfectly moist chicken with a thin golden crust.  My only complaint is there's not as much crust as I would like, but it's still a great pot pie.  Can't wait to go back & check out what else they have to offer!

Also, they have Uncle Scott's Root Beer from Mooresville.  Best Root Beer I've tasted.

I'm giving them three stars based on service, and what my fiends had. I unfortunately got the rotisserie chicken sandwich. In their defense I should've paid better attention to the description..it was shredded chicken with "jaco" sauce (which is BBQ sauce). It was what they said it would be..just sounded way better on the menu. But bad idea for a sandwich. The bottom bun was so soggy & heavy that it literally fell apart when I attempted to pick it up. It was at best an ok sandwich. The collard greens were meh, I've had WAY better. However my friends got a chicken wrap that looked ridiculous, and they said it was. So I'd give the food another chance. 

The bar service was on time! We went to see one of our favorite local bands play, WICKED POWERS! Luckily for us they had $3 natty green drafts..yes please! The bartenders were quick & knowledgable. They only serve local on draft, not sure about bottled.

Wonderful food with plenty of options. Ample parking. New Central location doesn't disappoint. Friendly bar service. Seriously love this place. Great place to bring anyone with ability to impress while keeping it low key. Tables inside or sit at the bar and watch football. There's also an outside area with overhead door that opens up to parking lot. Great addition to Plaza Midwood.

This place is a gem in Charlotte. My friends are always raving about the chicken here and it does not disappoint. 

Friendly service and a huge selection of delicious dishes will have you coming back for more. Chicken is a favorite here but you really cannot go wrong, everything on the menu is fantastic. Wednesday's are chicken pot pie days so you will definitely want to come then! It takes a bit longer to get the chicken pie as they are baked on demand and they may run out before the end of the night.

I gave this place 4/5 solely based on the food pick up on busy nights, the wait is long and it gets confusing on whose order is what. If they could streamline that process this place would be spot on!

The value here is outstanding.  They have the tastiest chicken and I'm really baffled by some of the reviewer's who didn't like it.  I lived in Charlotte the past three years and ate here frequently.   The squash casserole and buttered spinach are my favorite sides and the cornbread - YUM!

There have been some other eateries popping up right down the street on Montord, but this remains a gem. As someone who tries to eat semi-healthy and likes variety with my meal, this is the ideal place. And it's pretty affordable, in the $8-$10 range.

The main event here is chicken, with a bit of a latin twist. You can go the traditional Southern route with both how you get your rotisserie and the sides you choose. I like a little flavor kick, so I went with the Chicken and Black Bean combo, served over rice with that tangy jaco sauce. If you want to splurge calorically a bit, you can get the same thing with queso.

You can go sandwich style, or go for the platter. The platter is a great value, as it comes with cornbread and your choice of endless sides. You can sub in some tortillas if you want to tilt your meal further to the South.

There are many tasty sides, including mac and cheese, greens and many other staples. I went with the garlicky new potatoes and the special stir fry mix of vegetables, which included broccoli and squash. The veggies were fresh, and the potatoes were creamy. It will probably take a long time before you can try out every side here, but I really don't think you can wrong with any combo.

I like the fact that you order up front, and they yell out your name when it's ready, and be warned, the food gets ready fast. The only question with seating was the lighting, but then again, I think we kind of picked a bad spot and could have moved to a more open area. The soft drinks are only $1.25, and it's easy access for refills of soda. As someone who loves to experiment with sauces, I really dig the fresh salsa bar. That pico de gallo is spicy and excellent.

Overall, this is a great place. It always seems to be packed, so come during the slightly off-peak dining hours so you can order, find yourself a seat and be served quickly. As someone who lives in the 'hood, I look forward to many happy returns.

I'm a slacker for not writing these guys a review, did not realize I had not done so already!  Anyways, our office treated us to lunch here and it was fabulous as always!

I have had the pot pie - which is a special on Wednesday or Thursday, I think??  It had great flavor and it is HUGE!  I think it took me 3 days to finish.  My go to meal though has turned into the chicken on rice with con queso, which is what I had today.  The chicken has great flavor and of course so does the con queso.  My favorite sides are the squash casserole and the baked apples.  Large portions create for multiple lunches or sharing!

One other one that I have tried is the chicken and queso wrap - I think it is called this?  You are better off just getting the chicken with rice and queso, it is the same stuff stuffed in a wrap and it is huge - too much to hold in you hand and it falls apart.  Not sure about the other wraps, but to me, just avoid the wraps and ask for tortillas on the side of your meal to make your own small wrap.

Always have had great fast service and great food.  Love this place!

Best meal. Great chicken, great veggies. Cheap. I came in hungry and left full with leftovers.... And only payed $9
Cool bar and good beer selection.

With a chicken as their logo, RoCo didn't seem like it would a great spot for a vegetarian. However, I was thrilled to discover their MANY veggie sides which make for a great lunch. And the prices are UNREAL. You can get three sides with a piece of cornbread for ~$5. That's incredible! It's such a perfect lunch spot for the Plaza crowd.
The staff is friendly and will walk you through the menu if you're unfamiliar. The restaurant itself is enormous and there's tons of space, including a large bar. It will be interesting to see what kind of evening crowd this pulls! I think this is going to become a Plaza staple.

Man, I have been coming here forever, since I was a youngster, and I have eaten the exact same thing every single time!!!  The two soft tacos platter with a veggie on the side is definitely my main jam.  It's a cheap meal (under $6 as far as I can remember), perfect place for a quick lunch or take-out.

I flood my tacos with their signature "Tico Sauce" and savor every moment of it.  The atmosphere in there is cool, I love the tall booths and dub music.

If you're a vegetarian, they have a really super selection for veggie plates.  The white beans au gratin, squash casserole, black bean salad, smoked cheese & pasta... dare I go on?

It's the kind of place where you order & grab your meal at the counter, so there isn't a waitstaff, but my folks taught me well by always leaving a dollar on the table in appreciation for the busser's hard work.

How did I let so much time pass between visits to this place?!  The chicken and black bean combo is an absolute favorite.  Add in a couple of tasty sides, and a cornbread muffin, and I am one satisified (and stuffed) puppy!

Am I the only one who ponders copping a bottle of their sauce(s)?

Not your typical sit-down kind of restaurant.  You stand in line (lines can get LONG at lunch), give your order to the cashier and then pick up your meal when they yell out your name.  The staff shuffles an enormous amount of clientele through the place at lunch (dinner is substantially slower) but is helpful when needed and remembers the regulars.  

It's possibly my favorite lunchtime destination EVER.  I am currently a vegetarian but I've been eating here since my carnivore years.  (The chicken and black bean combo was excellent!)  My go-to order is the vegetarian combo, a mixture of rice, black beans, Jaco sauce (can only be explained as a cross between barbecue sauce and soy sauce...but that doesn't really work because, trust me, I've tried to recreate it at home!), cheese and chopped onions.  I always get the smoked gouda pasta salad...although there is no way that could be construed as good for me.  It's Nirvana on a plate!  All of the vegetables are delicious...daily specials disappear quickly!
My friend checked this place and there are lot of good reviews. So we tried it. Big mistake. The food has no taste. Drink if you want flavor.

My girls and I were out and about on the  town today and decided to have a pre Mother's day lunch. We pulled up the Yelp app and the Roasting Company came up. Not sure what we were getting into, but we were ready for the challenge. As we drove up we noticed that the restaurant was pretty laid back and inviting. In this place you are the waitress. You put in your order at the window and wait for your name to be called for pick up. It's was almost like my mom calling me to dinner. All utensils napkins and drinks were at your disposal. This was odd, but I found it pretty cool and different. The food was great and piping hot. I ordered the 1/4 roasted chicken which was delicious. The pasta and cheese salad was the bomb! The greens were a little to tart for my taste ( just a table spoon or two of sugar will cut the bitterness) other wise my lunch was great. My daughter's  had the chicken and rice with black beans. They absolutely loved it. They had a variety of sides which consisted of yams, cornbread dressing, bake beans and potato salad. All were good, however the cornbread dressing was to sweet. Regardless, we had a ball and I will be back.
Favorite place in the area. Living legend. The southern BBQ wrap is actually phenomenal and it had a great bar. Also serves food late.would highly recommend it.

Need to come here more often,  excellent rotisserie chicken, juicy and hot with awesome sides.  Dill potato salad is super creamy and baked beans are saucy with a hint of green pepper are my favorite ones, plenty more and some daily options.  Nice bar, this visit is way over due for a great eatery on a street with options, this is one of the best.  Cornbread muffins, you need more than one.

The food is delicious. I've had the Monterey Chicken Wrap several times, and it never disappoints. I would give it five stars, if the gentlemen behind the counter tonight would have not talked crap about me not tipping on my takeout order. Just like most of the world, I don't tip on takeout orders unless they are delivered or overly complicated. Furthermore, it's rude to complain within an earshot of your customers. Just sayin'

I had a layover for about 10 hours in North Carolina and I stop by this little place. What impressed me was the chicken pot pie. Unfortunately they had just ran out of it. I instead got the chicken with rice AND queso. With the corn bread dressing and green beans. They chicken with rice was amazing and so was the corn bread Dressing!!! The green beans not so much. Over all the beer was good and so was the food.

Great roast chicken & sweet potatoes plate! The RoCo standard food is delicious and reasonably priced. The new location is comfortable and nice decorations and lots of good local brews. The location is in the middle of plaza.  It's easy to imagine the outside in summer being a fun hangout. I like the food and the relaxing vibe. Parking is in the lot and easy to find in plaza, not typical.  Good chicken dinner for everyone!

We were in Charlotte for one night after a 10 day vacation, this place was close and had good reviews. We wanted something fast and good before heading to the airport early. The atmosphere is nice, good beer selection and plenty of TV's to watch football.  The food on the other hand was uninspiring and bland. The chicken was dry, the rice had parts that were not completely cooked. The greens were very bland, but salvageable with pepper sauce. The new potatoes and squash casserole were decent.  If I lived here I would only return for beer.

Fast, good, cheap chicken...
Quarter, half or full size...great flavor
Sides, sides, sides...mac & cheese, casserole, sweet potato casserole, etc etc.

Most items are under $10. Food comes out in less than 5 minutes and you can sit inside or outside. This place is great for lunch or for dinner by yourself or with friends or family. Bowling alley and movie theater are close by making this a great place for a fast, inexpensive meal!

When I was first invited to eat at The Roasting Company with friends, I hadn't heard of it before, but I was up for it.  When we got there, I thought, "Are you kidding?  It looks like a dive."  Once we entered, though, you could immediately tell that it wasn't a dive.  It just has the poor luck of being in what appears to be an old small strip mall.  

It's a good idea to pick up one of the menus as you walk in (and before you step up to the ordering counter) because there's a lot to choose from!  Their speciality is rotisserie chicken with a Mexican or Tex-Mex flair.  My favorite dish is the chicken and black bean combo con queso.  Why?  It's chicken, two sides/veggies, black beans, and cheese.  YUM.  Top that with one of their hot sauces and I've got a double YUM.  Now comes the difficult part:  deciding which two side items from the list of about 15.    Garlic or mashed potatoes?  Spinach?  White bean au gratin?  Baked apples?  AARGH.  I can't decide!  They all sound so good.  I've tried several over different visits and I can tell you that they're ALL good.  That makes it even tougher to decide. 

The dining room is pretty casual and not overly themed, but i like the high-backed booths for some privacy.

Bones bones and more bones!! Warning to those who shovel food into their mouth with food that SHOULD be boneless. More likely than not, your chicken con queso or chicken pot pie will have numerous bones in them. While their food is tasteful, it may be hazardous to your life !! This photo is a chicken con queso over rice which SHOULD be boneless. This is not an isolated case. Happens every visit. They should put warning signs on these plates!

The service was ok, we had some really rude service staff and at the same time some really nice service at the end. I had the black bean taco, it barely had any flavor. It was basically a tortilla and beans, nothing special and the ratio was definitely off. I would not recommend. However my husband got the bbq taco and he said they were really good. Overall mediocre.

Chicken Roasting Company is like your favorite pair of old jeans- soft, comfy, faded, make your butt look good (ok maybe a bit far). Anyway, it's the place you can go when you're so hungry you can't make up your mind what you want to eat. The place is casual, comfy and has quick counter service. There are a few outside tables, and a big tv always on sports. It's good for kids too.

The menu focuses on, er, chicken. My favorite is 1/4 white, With 2 sides. That means a 1/4 of a rotisserie roasted chicken (you can also get dark of even a half a chicken). each day in addition to their great regular sides, they  have a few special sides. My favorite special side is the spicy Mac & cheese only on Saturdays, but their regular sides of Tico black beans (which keeps turning into Ticonderoga on my iPad -DYAC!!), cornbread stuffing, sautéed veggies and mashed sweet potatoes are also great. In fact, the mashed sweet potatoes taste like pumpkin pie. Mmm, pie...There are some sides I don't love as much, so just find what you like. 

The menu also offers a couple entrees like chicken and rice, wraps (veggie wrap is good but is juicy so maybe ask to go light on the dressing or on the side) all for very reasonable prices. The 1/4 white plate is $6.80. It is equally friendly to the pocketbook and the stomach.  The only problem? I don't live as close to Park & Woodlawn anymore, so it's not as convenient. 

Bottom line: great place to get a solid meal for not much moolah when you're in your sweats.

How to go from first to worst in six short months.  There once was a time when this place served the best food in the city.  They have a new person working in their kitchen who is single-handedly destroying their business.  I have had to send back every plate of food this creep has prepared.  Today will be the last time I will visit this establishment.  I have made my displeasure known on several occasions - to no avail.  I kept coming back hoping the quality would improve.  I used to look forward to coming to the Roasting Company, now I find myself repulsed - all because of one crappy employee.  If you decide to eat here, I'd advise avoiding anything that is made with rice - unless you enjoy rice swimming in an excessive amount of  yucky, milky, buttery film!  WTF is that junk?  Who trained this idiot?  I'd give ZERO STARS if it was an option.
Delicious local delicacy. Great spot on Montford for a quick bite or a lazy afternoon. Awesome - easy to spot- selection of gluten-free options. Full bar. Nice patio. One of my favorites!

Tried out the new location today.  The place is convenient and parking is ample compared to the Montford Dr location.  The interior is light with plenty of seating in dining area and at the bar.   I was happy with the quick but helpful service and waited no more than 5 minutes for my buffalo chicken sandwich and side of black eyed peas.  Glad to have Roco in the neighborhood!

Yesterday was my first time at RoCo and I now understand why people love it so much! The restaurant is in a great location, there's an awesome indoor/outdoor space and the staff is exactly what you hope for when visiting this type of place. Jade was our bartender, she made an awesome cocktail (I recommend the one with kombucha) and was super helpful when it was time to order. I ordered the chicken and rice con queso with a side of collards. Overall the food was good, we did send back the collards because they were bitter and overcooked but everything else was yummy and very reasonably priced.

Very good and very consistent!!! Sides have no meat unless specified, which is great for Vegetarians, or ppl who just want to know what they are putting in their mouths.  Their roasted chicken is awesome and they are generous. 
 This is a quick place to eat and casual. You place your order, grab food when your names called, etc. 
 I haven't sampled the bar, yet- but there's always hope. Lol. Looks good. 
 Also, this place offers service with a smile and a large variety of sides! Huge meal, veggie plate or sandwich/wrap combo. No fries, but you won't miss them.  
 The only thing if any, that I'd change would be, a dessert or two, but even then, they offer a few daily, until gone. All good. You will get your money's worth and a full tummy!

It has been years since I have actually eaten here, but I stopped in for some beers with some friends last night and the vibe hasn't changed one bit.  Nothing fancy, but friendly and quick service was all I was looking for.

I don't know that I have much to say here, since I didn't get any food.  A great place to grab some beers.  Some awesome $3.50 beer specials.

I assume RoCo and Coal Trane's didn't discuss their rotisserie chicken plans with each other before opening.  Similar business plans within view of each other.

It's RoCo.  It doesn't feel quite like the Montford one.  I hate to say it, but its "too clean"?  I don't know it feels pushed, doesn't have that dive'ish hometown feel.  Beer selection ain't all that for my taste either.  That said, I was pretty sober when I went.  I'm pretty sure the first time I go in there at 1am with a buzz I'll come back and fix this to a 5 star rating.
Best prepared food for the money in Charlotte period. Now with a great porch and local beer bar, do not visit Charlotte and miss this joint. 5 stars all around.

RoCo as the locals call it offers some delicious roasted chicken and other Southern specialties.  The day my coworkers and I visited was chicken pot pie day.  Naturally, we opted for the special and it was definitely delicious.  It is piping hot, so use caution when eating.  Nice large chunks of chicken breast, peas, carrots, and potatoes are baked into a medium sized aluminum take out container with a crispy crust topping everything.
Super delicious, especially, with their habanero hot sauce.

Will return to try their roast chicken next time!
Hadn't been in years. Now there is a bar. Food is frozen in time - same exact stuff as ten years ago. Mediocre.

I stopped in for lunch with my coworkers and the place was packed! But lucky for us the line moved quickly. 

I chose the Monterey Wrap. First, it's huge! Trust me...you'll have a really hard time finishing all of it!

Second, they do not skimp on the chicken or toppings. This wrap had chicken, black beans, rice, onions and peppers and the best part - they top all that with queso! I really loved the flavor of the rotisserie chicken. So tender and flavorful! For my side I chose the white bean au gratin. It was very tasty as well! I was stuffed and happy and you can't ask for more than that! 

All in all this is a pretty solid lunch spot. I definitely look forward to trying more of the menu items.

One of my fave places in Charlotte! My parents have been eating here since it opened and i've known about it forever. I always love taking people who have never been there bc they are always so pleased with how awesome the food is!

Just a few of my favorite things!
Smoked Cheese and Pasta (pasta salad) - It's my absolute favorite!!! I cant come here and not order that. It's tangy, creamy, and just awesome.

The Wings - Order them traditional and get them with extra sauce... who doesnt like extra sauce? For dunking, pouring, taking shots...whatever...it's delicious.

Chicken and Queso over Rice - AMAZING. And get jalapenos added to the top. 

Tico Sauce - this stuff is the bomb.com! Vinegary, Tangy, a little Spicy... and perfect for everything they have. Put it on your chicken with queso.. put it on your salad. Ordered tacos? Put it on that too. Also, if you crave it all the time like i do, just buy a bottle and take it home!!! Yummmmmm

The summary of this review would be - JUST GO EAT THERE NOW. :) You wont be sorry. And they totally have a bar now - so drink up!

Almost wish I didn't work Uptown because this is a great lunch spot. They have a surprisingly large menu including everything from rotisserie chicken plates to taco salads.

Order at the register and wait for your name. They have a large dining area and some porch seating. Perfect for groups or individuals. Super quick, inexpensive, and delicious.

As for the food, I enjoyed my meal but was underwhelmed with my choice. The chicken and rice con queso was good, but the rice was bland in my opinion. Disclaimer: not a big white rice lover. But the chicken and queso and cornbread were on point. Next time I'll go the rotisserie chicken plate route.

Eager to try this place again, just wish it was closer to me.

I've been loving the Roasting Company since I would tag along with my parents and eat there as a kid. Carribean music and vibe, good beer specials, and really delicious chicken. 

I always go for the 1/4th white meal, but I've had the dark and it's delicious also. The chicken and rice con queso, monterey chicken wrap and chicken and black bean combo are also awesome choices. Go for the tico black beans, garlicky new potatoes, collard greens or cinnamon apples for sides - the stir fry veggies and white bean au gratin are a little bland compared to the rest of the selections. If you happen to come in when the mac and cheese or stewed okra and tomatoes are on special, definitely try those out as well.

The cashiers at the counter are always friendly and I've never left this place hungry. Perfect.

The beer selection...The majority is IPA. Like the majority of local restuarants, the only amber is omb copper. The food is like a cafeteria. The staff though is great. Just not enough interest to go back. If only they balanced the beer options, I'd come back.

This is one of those "regular" places for me. I make a 10 mile, one-way, drive to enjoy the Jaco Pork on Rice with squash casserole, and collard greens. The chicken is what they are known for and I enjoy that too. The portions are good, the price is right, the atmosphere is relaxed. You can't go wrong here for a good meal.

I ate here for the first time tonight for dinner. I sat at the bar with 2 friends and although I personally don't choose the bar for dinner it was a great experience. To start, we ordered margaritas. I give the margaritas a 5/5 (highly recommend). For dinner I ordered chicken on rice con queso with baked beans and squash casserole. I enjoyed everything but the squash casserole. It's possible that I'm not into squash casserole. The meal with 2 sides was only $10. For the option of macaroni I would pay $12. Please please add Mac n cheese to the menu  I got a to go plate for my husband with collard greens and baked beans. We will be back

My first and last visit at the Roasting company was a terrible experience.

called in a take out order Sunday 9/24, around 5PM, and was told it would be ready in 45 minutes.

Arrived to pay and pick it up 55 minutes later, and the order was NOT ready. Waited for 10 additional minutes there and it still was NOT ready. The girl at the cash register didnt seem to be bothered with this at all, like it was normal. 

Several other customer hanging around waiting were grumbling about how long it was taking to get their food.

Got refund and went to Midwood Smokehouse 3 blocks away and was out the door with my food in 10 minutes.

Lack of interest and concern by the staff was obvious.
Overwhelming smell of bleach as soon as you walk in the door.  No way I could eat with that smell.  I had to turn around and walk out...

We went there for lunch after reading the Yelp reviews and having to be in Charlotte on business. The first thing I'll say is that the parking is easy and that is always a plus when you are going somewhere you've never been. The restaurant is one in which you  pay and order at the register and then you wait and they call your name and you take your food to a table. Most of us order the 1/4 chicken, which came with corn bread and a side. This was the perfect size meal for lunch and is priced appropriately. Our orders came out quickly and we took a great table by the windows. The food was delicious. The staff is very pleasant and hard working. I will certainly return.

The good: Friendly staff, nice decor and great beer selection.

The bad: the food reminded me of what you would expect from a southern buffet, not completely terrible, but nothing special either. 

The bottom line is that I won't be back, because I can cook better than this at home.

Chicken was actually cooked completely done ( so many places rush the meat :/)  and moist; however lacked umph. Good chicken-not as flavorful as Viva. The sides here are more variety than the usual french fries&mashed potatoes. We love black beans!The squash casserole and smoked cheese pasta salad were yummy.  The spinach in the pasta salad was an unexpected pleasant surprise.  Corn muffins had real bits of corn. The place is like McAlister's where you order and leave your name. Get your food and leave your plates. Nothing fancy and sometimes that is a good thing :) So I can only speak on service of cashier. She was efficient and cordial.  Prices are very affordable and under $11 per entree. Will add to our dining out rotation.

When I lived in Charlotte I use to eat here at least once a week as this was near my office.  The interior restaurant has changed in the last couple of years which was a much needed renovation.

Tip:  Thursday - do your self a favor and get the chicken and dumplings!  You can't go wrong with that choice.  It is heaven in a LARGE cup!

Prices have gone up but still well worth the value.  Their chicken is ALWAYS fresh and there are so many different variations.

They now have a bar area if you have a moment to grab some however I never have since I have been on business on every trip.

This is mostly a self service including drinks.  You order, pickup when your name is called and sit and enjoy the food that melts in your mouth.

I am and will be a fan for years to come anytime I make it back to CLT
Very bland food, no flavor.  Unimpressed. Quiet atmosphere. Will not be return.

Had a yummy, hearty dinner here last night.  The chicken and rice was recommended by the cashier, with a hearty sample. The chicken was so tender, it fell apart with a spoon! The jaco sauce was wowzers good!  I had a squash casserole which was topped and baked with breadcrumbs and was delish, however I didn't care too much for the basil green bens, that were mushy and tasted out of a can.  The service is counter order and self service, but they didn't have any trays, which made carrying dishes and drinks, and grabbing utensils a treacherous trip from the open kitchen counter to the table.  
Will look forward to returning and trying out other dishes!
Must have. Squash casserole. Mashed sweet potatoes. And the Monterrey chicken wrap. My hubby's favorite lunch in Charlotte.

I wish I liked their food a little more, especially after reading all the awesome reviews of this place.  I got the chicken with rice, queso, and black beans with a side of sweet potato fries and a cornbread muffin.  It just wasn't packed with flavor the way I was expecting it to be.  The chicken part was kind of bland and definitely needed to be spiced up a bit.  Don't order their sweet potato fries if you're expecting them to be drizzled with a sweet or honey glaze.  I actually prefer mine salty but the pepper they add to their fries really threw me off.  The cornbread muffin wasn't too bad but it didn't stand up to my high cornbread standards.

I liked that the food came out pretty fast.  I also enjoyed the casual dining area. I was a little confused when we were finished eating because I had no idea what to do with my plate and glass.  This place doesn't have servers that come to the table so I was searching for a trash can to throw my stuff away but didn't see one.  We saw some other people leave before us that just left their used plates on the table so we followed suit.

I might come back to try out a different entree.  Hopefully this place has really good food and I just chose the wrong menu items.

This spot was recommended by Marissa at the hotel for a really good gluten free home cooked meal and microbrews. And yes, several delicious gluten free beer options including an IPA (very rare). It was better than expected or hoped for and the staff was wonderful! We had a really wonderful, fairly priced gluten free meal and microbrew!

Most native Charlotteans know about this hidden little gem of a place... they have wonderful rostissere chicken, flavorful black beans and great cornbread. They also have good chicken and dumplings which may not be on the regular menu but are sometimes the special of the day.  Love this place!

I've been to the Roasting Company on numerous occasions; that being said, feel free to take this review for what it's worth.

The Roasting Company just does not have the best food.  My co-worker loves this place, so we go at least once every two weeks.  I on the other hand am not a huge fan of their menu and how they prepare their foods.

At this place, you order your food at the counter.  Once your meal is ready (under three minutes in my experience), your name is called to pick up your plate.  One can opt to eat either inside or outside on their patio.  There are no trash cans; I leave my food on my table when I'm done...but I'm not waited on by anyone.  Am I expected to leave a tip...?

I have ordered a number of sandwiches and wraps from The Roasting Company.  The presentation of the entrées could not be better, however the quality and taste are negligible.  If you order a sandwich or wrap with any sort of sauce on it, you'll find that they include so much of it that your sandwich just falls apart and you make one hell of a mess.  Even on a sandwich without sauce, the chicken is so juicy to the point that the bread will act as a sponge and absorb all of it.  Nothing irks me more than soggy bread.  As for the taste, there is nothing special about their menu; you could make the same items at home (and likely not force yourself to contend with all the sog!).

I give them two stars for their killer sweet potato fries, despite the fact that they only make them on days of their choosing.

Love the food, great atmosphere, great beer selection. I wish there were a few more options on the menu, but other than that I enjoyed it. My family and I have ate there a few times now and I have tried various things on the menu and have enjoyed each dish. I wish they had a few more barbecue sauce options for the pulled pork, It was a little bland. The chicken wings were outstanding and I was happy to see that they had blue cheese dressing, which was very tasty I must add. Standing in line waiting for your food is a little awkward, and you half to go up to the bar if you want to order a beer. They ring it up separately from the register for the food. Kind of a pain in the neck. Minus my few mentioned pet peeves, the place is outstanding and I give them 4.5 stars..
Always a great meal. I'm not a slaw person but theirs is the best. Kitchen stays open till 2am!!!!! Yay. I tasted the pineapple casserole.....omg. Divine delicious confusion on the taste buds.

After a wry glance at each other after a workout, my wife and I decided it wasn't going to be a night we cooked in. I had passed by The Roasting Company a few times and had heard good things offhand, so I figured we would give it a try since it is right around the corner from where I live. Overall we had a great experience, pigged out on some delicious dishes, and enjoyed the laid back atmosphere.

Walking in is a little disorienting, as you have to go to the right and place your order. Almost all the dishes are inspired by their slow roasted rotisserie style chicken, which creates an intoxicating aroma as you pull into the parking lot. We ended up ordering the Chicken con Queso with sides of collards, squash casserole (our favorite!), and garlicky potatoes. In a style reminiscent of the backwoods eastern barbecue places I frequent back home, you wait for them to holler your name, then you smirk at everyone still waiting for their food as you make your way back to your table with your overloaded plate. 

We ended up sitting at the bar and getting CCC's baby maker on special for $3.50 (FYI it's much more expensive if you buy it at the brewery). We weren't too terribly hungry so we split the meal, which was a great choice as they don't skimp out on portions. Overall everything was prepared wonderfully and I liked all of the selections we had made. Also for the price, you are getting a pretty good bang for your buck IMO. While the main dish was awesome, the sides stole the show. They always have around 20 sides available, so I look forward to trying some different ones in the future.

Fun Fact - If you aren't sold yet, it is also one of Luke Kuechly's favorite places to eat. He considers it a pre-game ritual to eat there the week before the game, and blames the Atlanta loss on his not dining at The Roasting Company for the first time that season. Not to worry though, The Roasting Company made sure to send him a bottle of their Tico sauce so he could keep the tradition before the Super Bowl. You can read the article in the Charlotte Observer.

Same great RoCo, new location. 

My wife and I popped in here with our dog late on a Monday night after we were still starving from a sub par experience at the peculiar rabbit. The new space is certainly neat with a covered outdoor area that is dog friendly, a huge bar inside, and surprising expansive seating considering the location. We were able to grab some of our favorites (rice chicken and beans with Tico sauce, squash casserole, red oak drafts) with huge portions at a decent price. The big upside of this place is they are open super late even on a Monday when most everything else is shut down. 

Overall, great job with the new space and I'm glad to know I can grab some of my favorite comfort food when I'm on the other side of town!

OK Peeps, let's get it straight-this place is not Tex-Mex or Jamaican, its Costa Rican style food.  Whenever you see "tico" on anything, it refers to Costa Rica.  Plus cornbread made from heaven and collard greens for randomness.

When I visited RC, I was suprised by the daring mix of Costa Rican food and Southern food.  The smell of rotisserie chicken makes my heart sing, anyway, but it was even better to eat.  For around $8, I got an entire meal of rotisserie chicken, black beans, and spinach.  I ordered spinach to be healthy (must have been sick or something) and was shocked at how good  it tasted!  Not to mention the chicken...

This place is very homely-located above a rowdy Karaoke bar.  I applaud them for being so deliciously weird.  A salsa bar (as in sauce for tortilla chips, not the music), collard greens, mac n cheese, and tico beans?  The clientèle is awesomely mixed as well, young, old, hip and square.  This place is proof that Charlotte does have its own gastronomical character.
Great vegetables, even though baked apples is a fruit. I've tried the chicken and the pork dishes and love them all.

Its a Charlotte staple, a locally owned business, the stop that's outlasted every venue on Montford.  I've been coming to Roasting Co since I was in middle school, in my 30's now I still stop in monthly.  The food is still classic, the establishment has grown.  Full bar with a few TV's for sports, amazing fresh roasted chicken, and some homemade hot sauce.  Go on Wednesday, get the daily special Chicken Pot Pie, it will feed two.  Take home a cup of queso and chips, it will make you fat and happy.  Buy a tee shirt, support the fam.  Any other questions, stop in to get the answers.

Stopped by for a quick bite and had forgotten how great the good tastes. Hubby had pork and rice, garlicky potato and turnip greens, I had 1/4 chicken, spicy mac n cheese and stir fry veggies.  YUM!  We finished all of it and washed it down with Imperial Beer from Costa Rica which was the first time I had found it in the states.  It's a bit noisy if there are families there, although it did not matter to us once you start eating.
Local craft beer and sweet corn bread with jalapeño in it!? Wow this place has it going on!

Unfortunately ROCO is truly overhyped in my opinion. 

The booths have no cushion so are somewhat uncomfortable. 

If you are lazy (like me) you have to pick up your own food. 

I ordered the chicken and queso over rice with a side of sweet mashed potatoes, everything lacked flavor. My friend ordered potatoes, green beans, a pasta salad and squash casserole and everything lacked flavor expect the pasta salad which was delicious. Even the corn bread was somewhat dry. 

The service is the reason I gave it two stars, very helpful and energetic.

My favorite place on Montford right now because of the jalapeño pale ale from bird song brewery on tap. Also the portions are huge, definitely one of the best home cooking type placing around South Charlotte.

Would have gotten 5-stars except that my entrées never come out the same twice. Nice atmosphere and bar area, but you better pray you get a good, consistent chef the day that you eat there. On one visit my rotisserie chicken salad was one of the best I've ever had, the next it was missing key components and embodied food from a public school cafeteria.  Also, the salsa bar gets a little picked over sometimes and could use a couple more restocks throughout the day.

Based on the friend who took me to lunch here, as well as the full parking lot, I was expecting this place to be the best thing on earth.  Overall I can't complain.  The food was good.  They give you real plates and silverware, but yet it still feels casual and fun.  The prices were fair.  However, I was not blown away.  I got the 1/2 chicken with sweet potato fries,  The chicken had good flavor, but was a little tough and I could see this being replicated at most any casual dining place.  The fries were average and lacked that "something" that makes sweet potato fries different than regular fries.  The best thing on the plate was the cornbread - a real star here.  

One thing I really liked was the high backed booths, which made you feel like you were the only people in the restaurant, even when full.  Even with this, though, the acoustics were of such where it was hard to have a conversation, and the music was a bit loud.  

I really want to come back and try some of their more "tex mex" type dishes.  My friend works near this place, so I feel this is a reason why he
has grown to appreciate it more.  It is good, but not worth going out of the way for.

I heard a lot of hype on this chicken place and was excited to try it and when we got their the casual and fun feeling was nice, the menu looked great...but the roast chicken just didn't have any flavor/seasoning/taste under the skin!  I was disappointed in the lack of flavor to the chicken meat itself.  Also the sides were hit or miss, some were good, some  were too salty or too sweet.  I'll pass on this place...I like Viva Chicken better...I don't need the bar atmosphere as much as I need good tasty food!

Finally came back during peak lunch time instead of 3 pm and figured it out.  I usually headed straight to the bar which is full-service, but for everyone else it is counter service.  All the more reason to sit at the bar!

Just went there the other day for the first time, and thought it was pretty good! Also-they have retractable doors right near the bar-it will be a fun local place to hangout and grab a drink with friends once things warm up:)

This place is very much worth the drive. I had half white  Rotisserie I have 3 sides with it season corn collard greens and squash casserole. This food was so good it's all organic and they have some interesting sauces at the table try the tico sauce. The tico sauce with the chicken was excellent. And I must say the price is very fair they even offer a for side dishes platter before 5 dollars and 49 cents you can't beat that. I will be coming back here to eat again.
Great selection of local brews. Food was fast and delicious. Atmosphere was casual, comfortable, and classy. All around perfection!

A first time visit but definitely not the last.  I ordered the roasted chicken & black beans con queso and was more than pleased with the flavor and portion.  The bartender, Eli, was attentive and his suggestion to try the squash casserole was spot on.   If you are seeking a relaxed atmosphere & great food, check out The Roasting Company.

As a Charlotte Native, RoCo is always on the top of my list of recommendations for Charlotte newcomers. I'm one of those boring people who order the same order (chicken, rice, queso) every time, but have been occasionally swayed by some outstanding specials. Don't sleep on the buffalo chicken wrap if it's available. 

Let's talk sides: if you're a collard green person, get the collard greens. If you pretend like you're not a collard green person, try these. They are the way God intended collard greens to taste. If they have the mac and cheese: get it! 

The inside of RoCo is comfy/casual, although I do think their booths are in dire need of an upgrade/reupholster. Can't wait for the plaza midwood location to open!

Was lucky enough to hear about the friends and family soft opening at the new Plaza Midwood location of Roasting Company. I've been a loyal patron and huge fan of the Montford location for years, so I've been anxiously awaiting this location's opening since it's been announced. 

The interior buildout of this space is impressive.  The centerpiece and spotlight is the huge bar that is set up front and center with plenty of space for people to pop in and grab a bite, or hang out for a few casual drinks. Seriously one of the most impressive bar spaces in Plaza. There is a room directly in the front of the restaurant that has roll up garage doors and will be a perfect place to eat lunch on a warm Charlotte day. 

The food tasted 100% consistent to the deliciousness we all know and love. The kitchen was absolutely on top of it, and our food came out quick and hot. 

I can't begin to express how excited I am for this location's opening, and will be here more often than I'm willing to admit on a public forum.

This truly is a Charlotte classic!  It has been around for many years (and how many restaurants in Charlotte could you apply that test to?) and the food is consistently excellent.  I usually get the veggie platter which has to be one of the best-priced options in the entire city.  And if you want to have a relaxing bar experience, go there at night time.  The laid back ambiance is awesome!  It is by far the best restaurant on Montford Drive.

I cannot get enough of this place!  It's got a pretty diverse menu so everyone will be able to find something they like (if they like chicken that is).  

I love that it is NO NONSENSE.  You order your food, they call your name, you pick it up.  The end.  The people who take your order have it down to a science - they are fast yet friendly.  The only exception to the rule is the really tall guy with long hair.  He is the rudest person I've ever met, but he seems to be part of the establishment (although I haven't seen him in a while).  

The food:
I love their corn bread.  It is amazing.  It's sweet and moist and flavorful.  

I usually get the chicken and rice con queso.  Then I add the Tico sauce that's on the table.  I don't know what this stuff is, but it's so good.  It's not hot, but it does have a lot of spice and vinegar.  

My favorite sides are the squash casserole and the pineapple casserole (but this is only served occasionally).  The daily sides are listed up on a board above the counter.  

Also if you go on Wednesday, it's CHICKEN POT PIE day.  They have an excellent chicken pot pie.  It's huge and could feed at least 2 people (if you're willing to share).  

Overall: 
If you love chicken, you'll love this place.  They have a great selection.  They even have wings which I've heard were great.

The Roasting Company has been added to my official lunch list.  Walk in, grab a menu, walk up to the counter (or bar), order your food and grab a seat.  Your name will be called a few minutes later and you can go pick up your delicious chicken.  

I need to go back so that I can try all of the other delicious foods.

Great beer selection, amazing pot pie (on Wednesdays) and sides, plus plenty of seating and a cool patio area for when it's warm out. Pro tip: sit at the bar and ya get full service. Also the hot honey (I think?) sauce is amazing.

I'm an in-and-outter here (usually food to go).  However, I've sat at the bar a few times and the service, along with the food, could not be better for what they're trying to do.  I love rotisserie chicken and their's has always been juicy, hot, and fresh.  And the Tico sauce makes it even better, too!  Let's just say I'm a fan.

Roasting Co. is pretty good and a very casual setup. It's along the lines of Boston Market; Roasting Co is a step above BM. I will be going there again to try other dishes on the menu. The garlicky potatoes were good. Reasonably priced food and very similar to Boston Market but more like a bar. They are open until 2am so if you are ever bar hopping on Montford it's worth a stop in.

I can't get enough of this place for a quick lunch.  Plus, you can find many healthy options that taste great!  One of those rare places that I can leave satisfied and still feel good about myself for eating somewhat healthy.  Don't worry though, you can find your fair share of unhealthy things too!!

The Roasting Co. is my idea of what perfection is in a restaurant...why???

- Consistent, Supremely Delicious Food
- Great Prices
- Unpretentious, Laid Back Atmosphere
- Great Central Location for Most of the Town
- Fast, Friendly Service

When I lived in Charlotte, this place was a staple for me.  I've never had a bad...anything here.  

The rotisserie chicken goes w/o saying, it's excellent and a natural first choice for the less adventurous.  The Jaco (say, HA-ko) pork anything is the tastiest, most tender pig you'll find this side of Eastern NC 'cue.  You can't go wrong w/the Tacos, Sandwiches, and the Black Bean con Queso Combos (Pork or Chicken).  

Cooking meat well is relatively easy to do...to make one crave vegetables...is not.  You can go here just for the vegetable options alone and be more than satisfied.  I've almost consumed the entire spectrum here except the coleslaw and it's all good.  The 'tops' are the Basil Green Beans, Herbed Rice, and Mashed Sweet Potatoes.  The Cinnamon Apples can be savored as a desert in itself!  The Stir Fry veggies would be the only mediocre item on the menu I've had, but even they're still tasty.  

Bottom Line...Go...now...

Dined here for the first time last night. Sat at the bar (which is fully stocked, several beers on tap, even had wine on tap). Thursday they have 1/2 priced bottles. So we did the right thing and got a bottle. 

Atmosphere- reminds me of a bar, ya know cause it is one. TV's, wood, ppl laughing and drinking. Very clean, very casual, very perfect for a low key laid back evening. THey have indoor tables, the bar I mentioned earlier and outdoor/indoor seating.

Food - so RoCo is everything I thought Coaltranes was gonna be. The name Coaltrane makes me think of Jazz (John Coltrane, American saxophonist) but it's really like Viva Chicken but Mediterranean. This place is like a low key soul-food spot except all the chicken is roasted (hence the name). The FOOD IS DELish!! So I got a 1/4 (chicken) plate comes with 2 sides I got the squash casserole and the collards. It also comes with cornbread wait for it... with real corn in it! My friend got the rice plate which is essentially the same thing but with an extra side of rice (she works out so - carb it up). The food came quickly and it was hot. I was impressed with the seasoning on the collards - really good. I'm from SC and know how these should be made and they did not disappoint.

Price- this place is very affordable-our total bill including a nice tip (and the aforementioned bottle of wine) was like $45 bucks.

How to order - If you aren't sitting at the bar, walk to the back and go to the counter under the sign where is reads RoCo in big letters, like at Panera Bread, order your food and seat yourself and your food will be brought to you. 
If you are at the bar it's full service (food and drink orders). Not sure how the indoor/outdoor space works. I'll sit there next time. 

Would for sure come back ya know cause I like chicken and it was good!

I'm not sure how I haven't reviewed this place before now!! Seriously I eat here like twice a month haha. Can we say rotisserie chicken heaven!! Everything I've had here is great but honestly my favoritist thing is the squash casserole!! Seriously if you get a veggie plate you will feel like you've been transported to a southern Sunday church social!! I feel like they have the little old southern ladies cooking in the back!! Anyways their chicken is good, occasionally dry but I don't mind my chicken that way really. Their chicken pot pies are good and absolutely huge for the money. However the crust is a crisco crust I believe and that's not my favorite. I also recently tried the Jaco pork and it was amazing. My favorite things though are the veggies (haven't I said that already lol). If I get the quarter chicken or the veggie plate I kind of feel like it's Thanksgiving because there is squash casserole, sweet potato mash, green beans, mac and cheese if it's Saturday etc. If you order it through foodie call it's the one and only restaurant that your food will arrive 100% still piping hot!! 

If I'm craving comfort food and I don't want to cook this is my go to restaurant!

Full plate and tasty! The people I went with said it's jamacian...I'm not familiar. It seems a bit of a combo of TexMex with the different salsas. The chicken is flavorful and there are varieties of sauces to add to your entree. Lots of great side dishes to select (e.g., collards, potato salad, beans) Anyway, it was a quick stop for a fast lunch. 

The atmosphere is open and spacious. It's pretty chilly inside, so wear layers.

The roasting company is a great spot on Montford.  You go up to the food counter and place your order and pretty quickly they are calling your name to pick up your food. The rotisserie chicken is on point and the sides that you get with it are awesome.  I am usually not a fan of vegetables but you must try the white bean au gratin and the squash casserole.

My first 5-star rating... I left this place saying to myself "This is where I will take people when they want good food." 

That's got to be the highest honor in the restaurant business, right? 

Ordering food is quick and easy - walk up to the counter, menus are there but just ask the staff what they like the best. Always will give you something new to try. Always comes out good.

I get the Chicken Queso on Rice. Unbelievably good! Shredded chicken over rice covered in queso. The Mac & Cheese is spicy and different - the baked beans also have a kick. The cornbread actually has corn in the bread and sweet tea rounds off the southern experience.

If you drive too quickly down Montford you'll miss this gem... So slow down and enjoy!
