Never been disappointed by the food at the roasting company. I would say they use high quality ingredients and it's always super tasty. Prices are reasonable for the quality! We go whenever we're in the SouthPark area.

Got a chance to grab to-go lunch today while on a random day off. I tried calling an order into Three Amigos but they didn't answer. Then...I remembered we have a RoCo. Plus, they fixed the entrance to that lot so you don't have to jump a curb to get in there! My car thanks them. 
We walked past the room with the TVs, past the nice full bar and straight to the back corner for the to-go area. No wait which was great because it got busy after we arrived. I got the Monterrey chicken wrap. My husband, the quarter rotisserie with side of the day (Friday) of stewed okra and tomatoes as well as green beans. It came with a corn muffin. Mine was massive and was more like a burrito, I thought. It's too big too hold so had to knife it. Good though. I was not expecting it to be served warm. I got the white beans which were great and I could tell they were cooked from scratch. I'm
Excited about the selection of sides they offer.

Pork over rice was very good but next time I will ask for it without the Jaco sauce and use the Tico sauce they provide on each table. 

Squash cassarole was the bomb just as others mentioned. I could eat a whole pot of the at stuff!! Cornbread muffin was good also with pieces of corn in it...wish the muffin was bigger. 

Wasn't so pleased with the buttery spinach but guess it's a little hard to jazz up spinach...put some Tico sauce on it to make it better. 

All in all very good and I will be back to test other stuff!!

So good! Why have I never eaten here before? mashed sweet potatoes and squash casserole, both delicious! chicken with black beans con queso, its like the dish was meant for me! My friend got a chicken sandwich which she loved as well. I will definitely be back.

One star deduction for super strange layout. This place has a full bar that takes up most of the place but they also have a window you can go order at. Just feels a bit confusing to be sit down and order OR come to a window and order. 

One star deduction for bland food! I got the chicken, beans and rice dish that has the speciality bbq sauce over it and it was just plain awful. I couldn't even eat it. I did like my side of pasta salad and that was the only thing I ate. The menu is a bit strange, almost has a Mexican feel to it with queso on many dishes also has a Southern feel with the veggies and plain chicken. I think they need to get a bit more focused on the menu and the concept. 

One star deduction for the sauce bar being a mess and most of the salsa being empty. The staff member was even over there didn't refill them or anything. 

I won't be going back here unless it is for drinks because it has potential to be a pretty cool local neighborhood bar.

This is what I imagine prison food to taste like. We ordered two different chicken plates with various sides. Everything we ordered was watery and tasted like mystery mush. Even the stir fry veggies were bad-- how do you mess that up?

On the plus side, everything was timely and service was very nice.

First time there.  Got the Jaco salad which was awful.  Soaking in a pool of water, it had NO flavor whatsoever.  Tried topping it with salsa from the bar.  That was tasteless too!  Yikes.  Not worth a return visit for that, but I will try the chicken sometime since everyone here says it's so good.

I sometimes eat at the roasting company after work or grab something for the family. It is quality chicken and the squash casserole is amazing. I really like the feel of the place after they remodeled it last year. Definitely a great place if you like a rustic look and feel with good food / drinks and don't feel like getting fancy.

The food is good. Service was terrible. We put in a huge order for our company. They did not have it ready and then the guy was extremely rude to us even though we put the order in an hour before it was to be picked up. When people are spending a lot of money at your restaurant you should not call the business and be rude about it when you mess up. Good restaurant. Obviously can't handle big orders.... We will be ordering catering from other places next time. Sad I had to change my 5 star review due to the way I and others here were treated.

Can I do 3.5? Not quite worthy of 4 stars, but close. Very unimpressive when you walk in, but you can't always judge the quality of the food by the décor. I ordered the Jaco Pork salad, with the jalapeno ranch dressing. I scooped on some of the super spicy Pico de Gallo from the salsa bar too. It was very good, the pork was moist and flavorful. I was pleasantly surprised by how much pork there was in relation to the serving of lettuce. I wasn't impressed with the dressing at all, but the salad was still very good. 

My Daughter ordered the cheese quesadilla, with a side of garlicky new potatoes. She loved both, she even finished everything!

My Wife ordered the chicken taco platter, which was also very well received and enjoyed.

I was surprised that they weren't very busy, it was 12:30 on a College Football Saturday. There is no waitress service, you order from a cashier, then they call your name and you go pick up your own meal. Drinks are self serve too.

As Bill O'Reilly would say, "F it, We'll do it live!" I'm writing this one while still here waiting on my Baked Apples to cool down.

Restaurant decor is very impressive (although the booths need to be reupholstered) and probably the most standout storefront on Montford. Walk in and the bar is the centerpiece, with a highlight on local brews. Smoke is in the air from the roasters as soon as you walk in and that's a good sign!

First time here so I tried the Thursday special: Chicken & Dumplings, along with Smoked Cheese & Pasta Salad, and Baked Cinnamon Apples.

Took a seat and my food was quick to arrive. Chicken & Dumplings were good. Nice flavor on the thickened broth but it was overpowered by a mountain of coarse black pepper. I don't say that lightly because I tend to go heavy on black pepper myself, but this was very overseasoned. I couldn't pick out the more subtle flavors in the dish due to the pepper. Dumplings were nice and fluffy, I'm used to a bit more al dente for dumplings but these were fine all the same.

Smoked cheese & pasta salad, best thing I had. The pasta was perfect, dressing was light and bright, seasoned with dill and cucumber. I could eat this everyday. The only thing I didn't pick up much of was smoked cheese, or much of any cheese, but I would take it the same way again and again.

Baked apples... Would have been better as applesauce. The apples were dissolving by just trying to pick them up with my spoon. Unfortunately cooking them to this point, this dish has also lost a lot of its subtle notes like the dumplings. I just got tart and over sweet. Bit of a disappointment.

Regardless of the apples, with good chicken and great pasta salad I'm looking forward to my next visit. I'll probably try the Cornbread dressing as the little round of Cornbread I got was killer! Lots of potential I see here, I just gotta find the right things on the menu.

The restaurant is really confusing. The layout is very strange as you order and wait to get your good and then move to the other side to eat. The staff is a bit rude and impersonal. I'm not sure if I'm impressed.

I went their recently and was very  disappointed.  I ordered the 1/2 portion dark chicken it had little  flavor. The card greens were bland , forgot the tico sauce which was much needed. Baked beans were dry .I could understand if they were busy ,but they had few customers at the time.  This used to be one of my favorites places to eat . The cornbread was excellent.  Will try them again at a later date.

Came here for dinner with friends and loved it! We had been hearing that they had really good vegetables. I will be the first to admit I was skeptical since they are a southern place but was excited to give it a try. I had the vegetable plate, for my sides I had the smoked cheese pasta salad with collard greens. I could have licked the plate it was delicious! Can't wait to go back and try some of the other vegetable items on the menu!
This restaurant has Cuban Chicken. I had their chicken wrap last night with sweet potato fries and it was quite good.

Great great great. The chicken is pretty good but these sides are killer! The smoked cheese pasta, the squash casserole, white beans au gratin, cornbread dressing... The cornbread is steamy & moist and bad yummy little nuggets or sweet corn throughout. This place is a Charlotte gem.

I had the chili tacos, while they were good they didn't really offer a variety of toppings sour cream etc. the restaurant was clean, didn't like that they didn't have servers, but I understand it. Overall I was extremely satisfied with my lunch and so we're my coworkers. I couldn't tell which was the men's and which was the women's restroom, the M and W were hard to see. I would definitely go back.

Have been here three times in two weeks--delicious! Just wish their lunch specials were offered other days as well (even if it's not at a "special" price). Like their buffalo chicken sandwich a lot! Wings are tasty, renovation looks nice, more room to sit.
Great southern cooking with a hint of spice. My soon devoured the drumsticks in one bite. Chill atmosphere with no frills but lots of flavor.

Used to eat there a lot 18 or more years ago, the food is still as awesome as it was back then, there is nothing I can say to describe how exceptionally awesome their food is all I can say is drop whatever your doing, cancel any plans you had and jump in an Uber and get over there right now, you won't be disappointed.

This place is a hidden GEM in Plaza Midwood.  Nestled between the ABC Store and Bistro La Bon in an old strip mall, it would be easy to overlook this delightful restaurant.  

The menu is similiar to other local chicken restaurants - rotisserie chicken, salads, sides, salsas, etc.  The food is very tasty and I really enjoy the rotisserie chicken salad.  

But, what makes this place standout is the atmosphere.  There's a large bar in the center with beer and drink specials EVERYDAY.  There's a great indoor/outdoor patio area.  The service staff is super friendly and it's just a place that invites  you to kick back and have a few drinks.

Cool atmosphere & service. Food was not bad, but not the best. Missing flavor profiles majorly! We had the nachos, chicken sandwich & rotisserie plate but the chicken just had no seasoning. The dill potato salad needed salt, and the veggies kinda tasted canned, in my opinion. Cake for dessert actually had flavor but was terribly dry. Probably won't go back.

It was ok. I had the chicken and dumplings Thursday special. Good flavor, but the dumplings were runny and ruined the entire experience. Would I try it again? Probably not, but I can see some potential. So if you're in the area why not give it a try, you'll probably have a better experience.

Outstanding lunch. Multiple options, quick, and a killer salsa bar. 

The nightlife is great as well. They have the best local draught beer bar in Charlotte. 

This is probably my favorite place in Charlotte. If you're not a regular, become one.

This place has great food.  I love the chicken and black beans, but anything with their jaco sauce is great.  Their food has a little bit of a southwestern feel- they offer bbq, tacos, and have fabulous cornbread.  The only negative I have about this place is that most things come with side items, but the side items vary daily.  This is a great place for takeout.

I've had the authentic Costa Rican rice, beans, and chicken in Jaco Beach.  The roasting company's version is tastier! Their basic plates of rice, beans, chicken or pork, and two sides is a really great deal for the price.  I ate here a year ago and don't remember being impressed, but decided to try it again and this time it really hit the spot.  The black beans and white bean au gratin were perfectly seasoned and yummy.  The green beans were too watery  but still not bad.  The Pork with Jaco sauce was delish.  I will be eating here much more often.
Great place and great atmosphere now with the new renovations. Incredible beer selection as well and very friendly staff.

Love this place, great portions and great prices. I've never had anything I didn't like. Staff is always friendly and and always seem to be enjoying their job and seem to actually care whether or not they are putting out a quality product.

All in all, this was a borderline 2 star trip for me based solely on my satisfaction with my food. Service was good, i mean the order taker was friendly. Right at the get go, they do have a tip jar. Being my first trip, i gave a small tip feeling like a jackass if i didn't (albeit a small tip). Come to find out, i place my order, then i pick up my own food and fill my own drink, grab my own silverware, and you want a tip for what? Ooooh, i see there is no place to throw away my own trash. i guess that makes me feel better for leaving some tip.   

Anywho, walking in on a Monday to see that the special is a buffalo chicken wrap  felt like a good omen to me. Unfortunately, my wrap left me to continue my search for a favorite buffalo chicken wrap in Charlotte. At first, i thought they just forgot to put any buffalo sauce on it.  Perhaps they thought i ordered the bland chicken wrap instead?
Then it started to have a little flavor, but not much and by the bottom of the wrap, it was a soggy diaper wrap. i tried to add flavor with various salsa and sauces on the table, but couldn't quite satisfy the taste buds. 
The squash casserole was pretty good, but i found myself leaving half of it behind not even wanting to finish it. Same with the sweet potato fries, just kind of bleh.

My favorite part of the trip was when she put my order slip on the thing and threw it down the line to the cook dudes. i'm easily entertained.

Every Time I eat here I get the Exact same Thing and I always think they will not have it anymore or I will not be able to remember what is is called nor how to order!  The Staff here is probably Cousin to Vavid and very helpful!

Pork BBQ Wrap, Minus the Rice, Minus the Cole Slaw, Minus the Cheese and Extra Sauce called well I'm not going to mis-spell that on yelp, nor say it, though it is good!

Collards on the Side please!

I was staying at the Doubletree next to the South Park Mall with no feeding options other than typical suburban chains....a wasteland as far as I was concerned. I decided to wander through the neighborhoods looking for something a little more local and a little less factoryized.

I found it here.

The best I can say is The Roasting Company exceeded all my expectations. I like that they specialize in one thing (chicken) and they do it well. My 1/4 dark was moist and flavorful and the two sides were well worth trying.

I always try to sample New To Me dishes so I tried the Squash Casserole and Smoked Cheese Salad. I was happy with both. The casserole was helped out by the slight addition of hot sauce (Lisorno?) and the salad was just fine the way it was.

For southern-style grub this is a good as I've had and would definitely come back again.

Oh, by the way, my entire lunch including drink was under $10. A very good value.

Loved everything but the food. I really enjoyed the space, the bar, the look, the option to order at a counter and have the food brought to you. But the food itself was good but not great. Actually, the chicken was excellent but the sides seemed like they were doctored up canned goods. I would go back meet friends for drinks and an appetizer. But not for a meal.

Finally made it here for lunch after hearing good things and living near by for years. I was especially excited to try the Costa Rican inspired food after visiting the country earlier this year and completely falling in love with the food and culture. Unfortunately I didn't care for the food at all. I wouldn't say it was necessarily bad but just didn't suit my taste. I had the chicken and black bean plate with sautéed vegetables. I found everything overly salty and didn't like the sauce at all. I'm not a picky eater and like most foods (except turnip greens, I just can't sorry) but I didn't enjoy this meal. My husband ordered a wrap with chicken, black beans and queso that he said was just "okay." It was chicken pot pie day when we were that and that did look good and like a popular choice. We probably won't be back but it's a place everyone might need to try for themselves. Fortunately the prices are reasonable enough to do just that.

One of my favorite places in Charlotte, a must-try.

My personal is the chicken con queso which is just rice, chicken, and queso and sometimes I get black beans and sometimes not just depends on the mood.

My two favorite sides are the squash casserole and baked cinnamon apples I've been wanting to try the mac and cheese that's a special on Saturday but I did not get there early enough. Very, very good cornbread.

All of my friends love this place, they have really good wings as well as the chicken wrap are among some crowd favorites but you really can't go wrong here.

Came in on a Wednesday while visiting Charlotte.  Took an Uber from my hotel to grab a late dinner. 

The smoked pasta salad and squash casserole were good. The rest of the food was way too bland. I dumped a quarter of a bottle of Tico sauce on it to try to pep it up.  It didn't work :/  

I got the Jaco sauce on the side. My husband liked it, I didn't. Probably because I don't like bbq sauce, soy sauce or teriyaki and I believe it's some sort of combo of those.

Overall,  I'd skip this place next time I'm in town but some other Yelpers had better luck.

Tip: Go in under the "Roasting Co" sign and go to your right to order.

I will preface the next few reviews by saying that North Carolina has some of the best food I've ever had. I've been to the state four times over the past six years, and every time I come, I am blown away by the food.

Roasting Company is yet another place that serves great food for great prices. The chicken is tender, the sides are delicious, the atmosphere is cool, and the prices are very good. I got the soft tacos, spicy mac 'n cheese, and chili. The tacos are made with the rotisserie chicken, though they didn't use the most tender and juicy meat that I love. However, the lettuce and cheese were very fresh, as was the tortilla, and the sauce selection is pretty good. The spicy mac 'n cheese was a special vegetable of the day (I love any state that calls mac 'n cheese a vegetable) so it might not be available every day, but it was damn good; creamy, tasty mac 'n cheese with a real kick. The chili was fantastic; homemade from an old recipe, just the right amount of everything, and a good helping of shredded cheddar and sour cream on top. All that for about $8. If you're ever in Charlotte, definitely check this place out.

"Enough liquid smoke to kill a small horse."
I would recommend Viva Chicken...it's WAY better.

I have eaten here twice now and it just isn't very good. In fact, I would say the food kind of sucks. Here's why:

My first visit I had the chicken, beans, rice, and queso dish. It was pretty bland, not much flavor other than the basic ingredients--it felt like I was eating a bowl of cheesy beans, aka a side dish, not a meal. 

The second time I had the rotisserie chicken sandwich. Luckily I got the joco sauce on the side as it was inedible. Like, enough liquid smoke to kill a small horse. The potato salad was bland as well--not enough dill and the potatoes were cut too big.  

Both visits I found a tiny bone in my food. They warn about it on the menu. I don't see why it's so hard to not pull the bones off a baked chicken. 

The service was not quite up to par. Took a while to refill my drink and I had to ask for it.

Great food, good prices. Everything tastes fresh. The pasta with smoked cheese (pasta salad) is amazing. The service is quick and friendly. They have a decent selection of beers on the shelf, including my fiance's favorite, Imperial from Costa Rica. 

Their home made hot sauce is amazing, you can put it on pretty much anything. Not too hot, not too mild, just full of flavor and it has a chunky-like consistency.
Love love love this place. Never disappoints. Food is served fast, hot and fresh. I have never had a bad experience at The Roasting Co.
Went to watch the game there and oh my it was amazing! The squash bake is to die for!

Pretty rude service...  in an empty store, with no other customers, waited a few minutes while the cashiers cashed out their drawers... after a few more minutes passed asked if I could just tell the cook my order while I waited to pay... cashier then mumbled to her colleague "can't even wait 5 minutes to order."  Having worked service industry, this was just inappropriate.  Wished everyone a nice day and departed.

I came here for dinner since my friend stated that it was good and our food would be ready quickly. 

I ordered the chicken on rice con queso with a side of collard greens and garlicky (their term) potatoes. 

I was startled when a man screamed out my name.. apparently they do that every time someone's food is ready; if you have a heart condition do not stand near the counter..

The collard greens were good and so were the garlicky potatoes; I fear that the chef is afraid of salt though, as my entire dinner was lacking in overall flavor. There was barely any queso in my chicken on rice platter con queso and that is a major problem. Moreover, my entree was barely warm and the rice tasted rather old.

Service at the register was friendly and inviting, but the man at the counter gave me a bad attitude when I asked for a cup.

Overall, I would not come back to this establishment. The food was alright, the cost was too high for what it was, and the service was not the best.
We love Roasting Company!  Been eating here for years.  Would have given them 5 stars except I'm sitting here waiting for a huge to go order I placed yesterday, which they had no record of :-(.

We had gotten recommendations to try out The Roasting Company from a few friends. Maybe it was an off night, but we were pretty disappointed.  

I ordered the rotisserie chicken with black beans & queso. When I got my order almost 40 minutes later (it was busy, but not THAT busy), there was no queso. I went back up to get it which was fine. Even with the queso, which I eventually dumped the whole thing into, my meal was pretty bland. The sides were nothing to write home about either. The "buttered" spinach was awful, and the garlic potatoes were decent. Maybe we will give it another shot down the road...

Food:I visited The Roasting Company for lunch.I ordered the bbq meatloaf with a side of collard greens accompanied by cornbread. The meatloaf was seasoned well and tasted great.It was a huge portion too.I was told the collards were popular but I didn't favor them that much.Not sure if I had a bad batch but it didn't meet my expectations.The cornbread was tasty as it had corn pieces in it and a little sweet.

Service:The gentleman at the counter was very friendly and welcoming.I definitely felt appreciated as a customer.

Time for food:It took 4 mins maximum after placing my order to receive my food.That is awesome!

Setting:The restaurant is spacious and has an ample amount of seating.

I was really looking forward to trying this place, but never made it past the rude service to even order.  
Went in at 11:30am (they open at 11:00am) and there were 2 cashiers and another person at the register counting out the money in each register...fine, no problem. We waited patiently & after about 10 minutes, the cook came around to the front, so we asked if we could go ahead & put in our order (so that he could start) and we would pay as soon as they were finished counting out the till. The girl standing there huffs at us, rolls her eyes as she picks up a pen to take our order and mumbles "can't you even wait 5 minutes?!".  That was all we needed to hear...we said "thank you...have a good day" and walked out. 
I would understand if it was before their opening time or a few minutes after...or if they simply said "do you mind waiting another few minutes"...but to give that sort of attitude?! No thank you!  There are plenty more options in Plaza Midwood with much friendlier service.

I thought this place was excellent quality for the price.  The chicken was delicious and I loved the amazing selection of side items.  The sweet mashed potatoes were great as well as the roasted veggies.  Overall I will be back a lot more now that I know it's here.  Plus it's totally Paleo

Top notch place that falls just short of its predecessor, albeit being a brand new addition to Plaza Midwood.  Obviously this is not a negative review by any means as I am a huge fan of RoCo as they absolutely deliver quality chicken and sides at a great price, but I am hoping they work out some of the kinks at the new location.  For example, the sweet potato mash and corn bread are magnificent at the Montfort Location but they are severely lacking here for whatever reasons.  The chicken was great though and I really like the layout of the new location because it's massive, has a great bar, and even has a convertible patio for when it happens to be nice outside. Hoping to be back soon to see the improvements in some of the side dishes that I love from the original RoCo.
You have to try the squash casserole! Some of the best eatin' Charlotte has to offer!

The only reason I give it 4 out of 5 stars is because Henry the bar tender. The food is amazing. I've been here 100 times and never had one bad thing to say about it. But tonight the bar tender Henry was just straight up rude. He threw the menus at is when we sat down. Neglected us as we dined. And even tossed our bills at us when we were closing out. We would have drank more had we not been neglected. Needless to say. Next time I go back. I'll make sure he's not working. Or else o will. It attend. He did have a great taste of music. But a terrible personality. And ruined my experience/night. Thanks a lot Henry. See you never. Hopefully.

Came here for a late lunch. We got a seat at the bar (full service here). I just had a water and I ordered a sides platter - rice, stir fry vegetables, salad and it came with corn bread.
Everything tasted pretty good, and fresh. The only problem I had was with the dressing. I ordered Italian but it just tasted liked oil. 
The service is alright. The gentleman taking our order was new (he told us) so he did not know the answers to a couple of our questions.
This is still a pretty new spot and I'm sure I'll be back in a couple weeks to try it out again.

This is my favorite chicken place in Charlotte. They have so many options. It is like a chic southern twist! I love the chicken and cheese and my boyfriend had just the chicken and rice and it was amazing too. The dill potato salad and greens are to die for!!! I can't wait to go back

This place was a lifesaver! We were stuck overnight in Charlotte due to a missed connection (not our fault!) and needed food really late! The Roasting Company came to our rescue with a closing time of 2 am and with very delicious food! Delicious roasted chicken and great sides. I would not go far as to say that the sides are vegetables (or at least healthy ones) but they were so so so good! Yum! It took quite a bit of restraint not to order another quarter rotisserie chicken and I totally would have if I hadn't eaten all of the sweet potato and cinnamon apple sides!! It's so good!

I didn't know what to expect from this place since I don't eat meat but this place exceeded my vegetarian taste buds! I ordered the vegetarian combo minus the cheese! It was absolutely delicious instead if the corn bread I got the tortillas! It also comes with two sides I got the stir fry veggies with the collard greens and turned my lunch into a southwest combo! The only thing that through me off at this place is I didn't know if I should sit and order good or order at the register. When you go here order at the register! This is a chilled laid back place to grab a good bite when your on a budget!

(go with 2.5 stars) 

RoCo is officially a no-go for me.

It's located in the shopping strip off Central Ave that contains Bistro la bon. They boast an open, covered front patio and a spacious interior that includes a wraparound bar.

When you walk in, you are given the option to order at the back cashier or at the bar. Once you order, you can take your seat anywhere, however, make sure you stay pretty close so you can hear your name being called once your order is ready. If you order at the bar, the bartender will typically bring your food to you.

On a recent Tuesday evening, I popped in before a meeting excited to try their Tuesday special: the buffalo chicken sandwich. The chicken was fried hard and dry. Cue my immediate disappointment. The bread is/was not sturdy enough to sustain the large chicken patty. They should consider potato buns instead. I ended up taking the chicken off the bread and just dipping it in sauce I asked for on the side. I decided to try the garlicky new potatoes as my side and I'm so sorry that I did. They tasted as if they'd been sitting out all day and were served in a soupy like consistency of garlic sauce. Not appealing to the eyes nor stomach.

During my first visit, I tried their roast chicken and I have found that to be their one bright spot. However, I find that there are other places that serve much better roast chicken so it's not quite good enough for me to specifically make a stop here for it. What gets me is that their sides taste no better than what you would find at a cafeteria. I've had the stir fry veggies, mashed sweet potatoes, and now the garlicky new potatoes. Every single one has been a disappointment.

When I had the stir fry veggies, the medley consisted of mostly onion. FAIL. The mashed sweet potatoes were okay but they didn't taste fresh or made in-house.

For my first visit, I ate at the bar and the bartender was very nice. My second visit, I ate on the patio since the weather was nice. After you're done eating, no need to worry about clearing the table.There are signs letting you know that someone will come to bus the tables. 

Roco, I really wanted to like you more because I have had better at the Montford location.
Our family gathered here for dinner last night.  It was quickly served and delicious food.  The chicken was great and the pulled boston pork my husband tried was tasty!

I hadn't been to The Roasting Company (or RoCo as all their signage inside said) in about 12 years, so I was excited to see all the changes after they revamped and added a bar. The fella and I stopped in for dinner on a Wednesday night, and we were a little confused when we first walked in. Yes, there's a big ol' sign right above your head that tells you to order at the counter, but still.

We ventured over to the counter and searched for a menu. The sides and veggies of the day were written on chalkboards, but no menu to be found except for the paper to-go ones. There were two cashiers, and I had to wait for them to finish talking to each other before one finally took my order. 

I got the 1/4 rotisserie white meat chicken with rice and black beans, and the fella got chicken with jaco sauce and rice. There was SO much meat on my chicken!! And it was moist and delicious. My rice and beans were pretty tasty, too. I tried the fella's chicken since I had never had jaco sauce, and it was like a sweet, smoky barbecue sauce. 

He wanted a drink, so we had to pay for our meal at the food counter, then head over to the bar to buy the drink, which was a little annoying. I think you can eat and drink at the bar to put everything on one check, but there were no seats there when we went. By the time we leave around 7 p.m., the place was hoppin'! 

Overall, pretty delicious food, especially on a cold, winter night, but the service was a little iffy for me, so A-OK it is.

The Roasting Company has become a go-to lunch spot for me.  Their rotisserie chicken is at the center of the menu: they do sell other proteins, but you need to try the chicken on your first visit.  Pretty much any form of it is a winner, except on top of a green salad.  The chicken itself is fine, of course, but you can find better veggies elsewhere.  If you can't decide and want to start off with something distinctive, get the chicken on rice with jaco sauce.  It's spicy, tangy, and filling.

The sides here are really good as well.  If you feel like indulging yourself, try the pasta with smoked cheese.  This isn't your run-of-the-mill mac and orange-stuff.  If you want to be healthier, the black beans are the way to go.  Oh, and to make everything even better, there's a salsa bar.  

My only caution is that parking can be ... exciting.  It's cramped.  Check over both shoulders before you back out, folks.

This is probably my favorite place for lunch. The side items are so good it is hard to choose what to get. It can get crowded but it is worth the wait. My favorites are the wonderful pasta salad, their slightly smokey collard greens and the sweet potato fries are the best I have had. Love to dip them in their queso.

Wings are good!  Hot honey is what I like.

Chicken nachos are worth trying.

I've eaten here several times and I have never had a bad meal.

I had high hopes for this restaurant as people rave about it, but I've been twice since it opened and I'm still just not that impressed. 

The first time I went with a girl friend we both got roast chicken meals, I ordered potato salad and green beans. The green beans were cold, mushy, and tasteless - they were missing seasoning. 

The chicken wasn't very memorable. 

The second time I went with my husband on their grand opening weekend. They were offering discounted entrees and commemorative cups. We each ordered white chicken meals. I did not make the mistake of getting green beans again, however I was still not impressed. 

They look to have a nice bar set up, I might come back for that.

I stopped here one lunchtime with a couple of coworkers who recommended the place.  After seeing the outside of the building, I was a little dubious --it felt like there should be a 50 gallon drum outside with a roaring fire and a couple homeless folk keeping warm.  Once we got into the building, that thought didn't go away.  The restaurant itself was a bit, hmm, used, maybe --lets just say it looked though it was in need of some updating.  

When you walk in you're presented with a board and a bunch of menu items; right beneath is where you order. --If you've never been before, it might be helpful to checkout their online menu prior to going, otherwise you may be deciding on something in a split second --especially if there is a line behind you.  Soon as you've placed your order, you're shuffled off to the side in true McDonald's style and you wait for your food the be thrown up on a grab-it-yourself servers shelf.

Waiting for the food I had all kinds of interesting thoughts flying through my mind on what it might be made from.  However, that didn't have to last that long --it took ~4 minutes to serve up my hot lunch --a whole minute quicker than the average Chinese joint; that's impressive!

I got the food and I was very pleasantly surprised.  It looked just like a home-cooked meal --not one which had been ordered in a restaurant.  It smelt amazing, looked fantastic, and only took 4 minutes --that's enough to make Stouffers jealous!  Again, to my surprise the food was extremely tasty.  The chicken they use was actually off a full cooked chicken and not from a frozen bag.  There was some salt in the meal  that had been added for taste but not a crap load of MSG flavoring all over the rice to make it taste unnatural --it almost reminded me of when I was a kid and the food was made by mum.

This isn't your typical eat-out kind of restaurant.  If you want a nice home cooked meal without cooking it; this is the place.  It was a nice refreshing change from the typical lunchtime eatery you find.

I will certainly be going here again, I really did enjoyed the food, despite the interesting appearance of the place.

Roasting Company has the best chicken around! They are quick and the food is fantastic! We've lived in Charlotte for 6 years now and tried Roasting company once and have been back monthly ever since! They have done alot of renovations to their store the past year or so and it's great! the store looks much better and there is more room to sit. I highly recommend Roasting Company!!

On my first visit I had the roasted chicken, which was flavorful and moist.  The chicken pot pies are by far the best I ever had and are consistent every time...they have mastered this dish.  They are so good that I have not tried anything else on the menu since the Wednesday following my first visit.  The serving is huge and packed with flavor!!!  The crust is delicious and holds up perfectly (never soggy or wet, even when reheated after being refridgerated overnight).  In my book, they are fully deserving of a permanent spot on the menu rather than just on Wednesdays.

Nothing complicated, nothing fancy, nothing expensive. Just good food served quick! Although a bit confusing for newbies like ourselves we weren't sure if it was a table service spot or a self serve serve spot. We decided to order from the self service location because they seemed friendlier than the bartending area. 

 I rarely order chicken when I go out to eat but it seemed fitting at this location and I'm glad I did! It was delicious and moist and flavorful! Their sides were also delicious! Garlicky potatoes, baked beans and even the Dill Potato Salad was good. Their pork Tacos were great! Not stingy with the pork they were very juicy and filling. 

 So after you place your order your food will be served up nice and hot and very quickly! Pick any table and enjoy! Their sweet tea is THUMBS UP!

One of my favorite places in Charlotte. There is nothing fancy about it but I get good food every single time. One of my favorite items is the Chicken and Rice con Queso.

But, the thing that I will always order no matter what else they are offering is the Squash Casserole as a side. Good grief it's amazing!

This is great for lunch during the work week or after church. It is usually pretty quick even during busy parts of the day.

I need to try more things on the menu but no one I've talked to has ordered anything there and not declared their need to come back as soon as possible. It is sort of tucked away on Montford so I too often forget about it. But this review helped me decide where I'm going for lunch today!

They roast chicken....we get to enjoy!  Other than the oddly-placed meatloaf special on Fridays, this place is all about the yard bird; although the meatloaf is pretty killer.  This place has the best chicken pot pie I have ever had....good luck finishing it.....

I didn't know what to expect with this place as the inside is a little run down and what not. I thought the chicken was awesome. I had a side salad which wasn't worth getting and enjoyed potato salad. I thought the price was very cheap for the amount of food you got. I would come here again.

Vegetarian plate with rice and beans was yummy. If you don't eat meat - there are still options. Plenty of sides if you're okay just doing a sides plate.

Boyfriend got a chicken plate and said the chicken was good and cooked well.

Good portion of food for the price.
So happy to have roasting company in Plaza Midwood since we move to this side of town. Cheap, quick, and open late!
Great spot for a quick lunch.The chicken is above average and they have a great variety of sides. I eat here on a regular basis.

I've been going here since I was in high school. The food itself is the best in Charlotte for a proverbial hole in the wall restaurant. Food taste great, it's reasonably priced, and you get it quickly. If you're newcomer I would recommend either the Monterey chicken wrap or the Jaco pork wrap. The best sides are smoked pasta salad, mashed sweet potatoes, or any of the casseroles.

Would help to have the dining room tables cleared quicker and the tables need to be cleaner.

Ate here yesterday with a co-worker for the first time in a while, and realized I had never reviewed it!

I REALLY like this place. Can't say much that hasn't already been said, the reviews speak for themselves. Great rotisserie chicken. I love the jaco pork, especially the tacos. 
Cool little salsa bar.....great prices. Yea, i'll be back for sure.
Ordered at 7:25. By 7:50 still hadn't gotten food. Had to cancel. Didn't know they were 20 minutes behind until I had to cancel. No empathy or apology. Terrible service.
This place is exactly what you want for lunch. Casual atmosphere, bombastic food, large portions, good music, drink specials... I'll be back.

I had the chicken salad sandwich and it was good but could have used a little punch of some sort. However, I thought their wings were a touch better.

On the wings, they were a bit light on the sauce and didn't fully understand what I meant by crispy I guess. I ordered them with Hot Buffalo sauce and got the nuclear on the side since several of us were eating them. The nuclear is fairly hot but on my scale not nuclear. Very meaty wings.

I frequent Charlotte quite a bit and was tipped off about The Roasting Company from a picture I saw on "Charlotte Agenda's" Instagram. 

There a 2 locations in Charlotte one in Montford the other off Central Ave. we opted for Central Ave. 

The restaurant is a cool trendy spot with outdoor/ indoor seating area as soon as you walk up. And a massive exposed brick wall lining the inside. You walk up to the counter to order and then seat yourself or you can sit at the bar which is full service. 

Now onto the food! The food was amazing and the portion sizes were hefty! The sides were all amazing (I tried 4). The smoked cheese pasta salad was hands-down the best side by far!  This spot I would def recommend to anyone that lives in the Charlotte area or even anyone visiting!

This visit I had a 1/4 white meat roasted chicken, collard greens, and squash casserole. I believe every dish comes also with a little bit of cornbread. The cornbread was good, not to sweet and had actually little pieces of corn in it for texture I suppose.

The greens were okay, a little bland. The squash casserole was my favorite, but I love squash so..... 

The chicken, for me, lacked a little flavor. I noticed there was a sauce/salsa station in the back where you could add your own  to your chicken. I was not really interested in this idea. I would have rather had the chicken seasoned before or during the roasting process. 

Overall my meal was not bad, I received A LOT of food for under $15. I took the rest to lunch with me the next day.

This location is nice as well, they have a patio area in the front and lots of space inside. Clean restrooms.

This is my boyfriend's favorite restaurant in Charlotte hands down.  They have the most amazing rotisserie chicken and their sides are incredible.  I highly recommend the smoked cheese pasta salad, squash casserole, cornbread dressing, or garlicky potatoes.  If you're a vegetarian you can have a great meal by just getting a side plate.  It's always super fast and the atmosphere is nice.  The prices are also great, you can get a huge meal for under $10.  They also have a full service bar where you can order your food if you sit there.  I will also mention they have an incredible chicken pot pie on Wednesdays however to get it you will probably need to get there by noon.  If you go to one restaurant in Charlotte make this your spot!

I got the three veggie plate and their squash casserole is the best around.  I also got their Cole slaw and stir fry veggies which was good.  Their cornbread is something I always look forward to.  This is the second time I got their veggie plate and it didn't disappoint.  Next time, I will be trying one of their salads which I saw from someone next to me was a really good portion.

The Roasting Company has to be one of my favorite spots to grab some fresh southern food with a bit of a Tex mex twist. Their garlicky new potatoes are mouth watering when paired with their basil green beans. Their location on Montfort Dr is super convenient but be sure to park around back as it's typically pretty full. The best part is they're open late which is perfect whether you're eating in or taking it to go.

Best place yet I have been in Charlotte!!!  Great Beer selection ! ( Wooden Robot)- and me...I give you 10 stars in being able to figure out how the hell to actually cook vegetarian side dishes that are really vegetarian!!  Guess what no one else can figure it out!  Bland Bland bullsht! Your food was awesome and I as a long time vegetarian so appreciated actually trusting that your side dishes were vegetarian!  I had the 4 sides and cornbread.  Squash casserole was dynamite and had beans, corn and greens!  Yum you guys!!! Thanks for being vegetarian respectable! I know my meat eating relatives loved the other food too!

The Roasting Company is hella dope! I just got four sides of veggies and it really made a complete meal. It tasted like home-cooked food like grandma would make, if my grandma were Southern, that is. I got the squash casserole, the cheesy grits, the collards, and the green beans, and then because of a mixup I got the apples for free, those things are so good. The only thing I didn't really care for were the green beans, they seemed like they were from a can and I'm not a big fan of canned food. The prices were awesome- my plate came with a really good little cornbread muffin and was just over $5. If I lived in the area I would eat here often for sure. It also had a homey ambience. The customer service was great. The people working there are super friendly and sweet. Roasting company hit the spot when I was craving something healthy Southern style food with a lot of vegetables, and I was very glad that the veggies didn't have any meat added to them!

Wowie Zowie!!

This place is awesome. I've eaten here for lunch and dinner before, and I would do it again. 

The Jaco Pork and rice is awesome. It might be better than the chicken, but they're both great. If you get the. Chicken and rice with queso, put some Tico sauce on there!

The sides that I've had were great. The smoked cheese and pasta (it's a pasta salad) was really tasty, and I usually don't like pasta salad. Cornbread was great too.

This is a nice place to go for generous portions.  they serve roasted chicken (as to be expected for someplace named the roasting company!).  You can get tacos, some sandwiches and a dish called jaco pork (with rice).  There are side dishes, wraps and salads as well.  Prices are reasonable ~$8 for a plate and $6.50 or so for a sandwich.  The food is tasty, prepared to order (mostly) and arrives in minutes.

I have been for lunch and dinner and enjoyed every meal!

This place was great! The food (roasted half chicken and chicken wrap were our entrées) is amazing. My wrap was larger than q large burrito. The atmosphere was a dive and really cool. Food is served on real plates with real silverware and the food is cooked with special care. The 2 of us are for $22. You will not fi D a better bargain.

Love the fresh roasted chicken for lunch or for dinner. Also the assorted sides are healthy and tasty including collard greens, white beans, squash casserole, and all sorts of good things too many to list here. Wait, I need to list that corn bread with bits of corn in it-- good stuff.

This is a true Charlotte gem. Glad they are in business and doing well.

The Roasting Company is always a safe bet.  Succulent chicken and a variety of sides.  Go to the counter, tell the cashier what you want, and lickety split your order is ready.  Today I had a quarter chicken with dill lima beans and the cinnamon apples.  Those cinnamon apples were something to write home about!  It was served up with a corn bread muffin. Despite the fact they only had dark meat when I ordered, it was still tasty.  I do wonder, however, how a chicken place can run out of white meat. Hmmmm.   It's in a warehouse kind of building and it was jumping with millennials.   I was there representing the baby boomers.   Apparently the other boomers stayed home today.

Great sides, fast service, and great local beer. There daily specials are so good they usually always sellout- so get there early.  salsa bar is always yummy. This Place is never crowded and offers parking which is nice.  They have a great variety of sides, the squash casserole is my
Favorite!

So happy for the RoCo that they are successful and expanding BUT..... the Montford Dr Store needs a little love, or at least an experienced manager.
My husband and I have been eating at the Roasting Company once a week for years. While we have experienced an "off night " every now and again, the quality of the food and the friendliness of the staff and continued to decline over the past 6 months.
While we understand staff turn over, I truly hope the RoCo management will take a hard look at the food coming out of the Montford Dr kitchen. There needs to be some consistency. It's pretty basic stuff that they have done so well for so long.  And a smile goes a long way :)

**Thanks Doug for the comment. I wouldn't have posted this if I wasn't concerned. We have really noticed a difference and are concerned about our favorite restaurant. I hope the quality returns.

First time to this little gem, Great Roasted Chicken and the sides!! Wow ! The sides are amazing, never have I seen so  many great choices...from Squash Casserole to Pasta with Provelone to Seasoned Corn. the Selection goes on and on and also adds different ones during the week. I wanted to try just the Chicken and 2 sides. It was great..not a tiny chicken like you get at some places but a nice sized breast and wing, thigh and leg combo. Very Juicy and warm.  Their Barbecue sauce is delicious..a step away from the norm - I think it must have coffee in it...Wonderful!.  A couple of salsas top off the additions to make your roast chicken more tasty!  I will be coming back...I would even do the 4 sides and cornbread next time..I wanted to taste all the veggie!!!
Fantastic takeout, the best half roasted chicken in town. The queso is popular but I didn't love it. Definitely try the squash casserole.

The service and food here are great!! Sit at the HUGE bar or counter service for everyone else... Jade is the BEST !!!!! Great drink specials ...trivia on mondays ...cheese grits on special on wednesdays !!!! Food is so reasonably priced and I can't wait until the summer because the front open air patio will be jumpin !!!! great vegetarian options too!!! Located in the heart of plaza midwood park eat and enjoy the neighborhood!

This place goes to show that a simple concept can lead to great success!  Having bookmarked Roasting Company for some time, my latest stop in Charlotte propelled me to stop in!  A little confusion as to where to go and what to do, without anyone at the front to explain, I figured out to go through the dining area to the back right area to order.

From suggestions from a employee, I ordered the Chicken Black Bean Combo and a 1/2 Chicken with sides of Squash Casserole and Sautéed Veggies!  

The combo is chunks of their rotisserie chicken over black beans and rice, then it's topped with a housemade queso sauce.  It's absolutely phenomenally good!  The squash casserole that I had with it was equally impressive!

The 1/2 chicken white, with a side of stir fry veggies, was again a impressive dish that due to the slow roasting of the chicken!  It literally falls off the bone and the stir fry will impressively surprise you!

My only knocks on the place is the lack of knowledge of what to do and where to go when you first go in.  The other is their way of calling out your order once it's ready.  The lady working the pass will literally scream your name out to the point that if you're sitting near that area, it's annoying as hell!  Your constantly bombarded with someone screaming throughout your meal!  The food is incredible, just bring your earbuds!

Our family visited this place for the first time yesterday, and I was completely underwhelmed. First the experience, then the food.

You order at the counter, then stand around waiting for your food. This part of my experience was the most infuriating. As I said, we visited with family, so we were hoping to spend some time together. This was impossible because at least one person must stand up front the entire time waiting for everybody's order, while the rest of the group can visit with one another. So there I stood for a solid ten minutes, getting hungrier and more irritated with every passing minute. Finally the food starts to arrive at the pass, and, unless you have 4 hands, be prepared to make several trips back and forth from the table to the counter. I don't understand why they can't supply their customers with trays to simplify this process. Also, when you're paying they request a tip, but they do absolutely nothing to earn a tip! Do you tip the people working at Mcdonalds? RoCo needs to do something more like Viva Chicken where you get a number, find a seat, and an employee brings you the food. However Viva Chicken doesn't even ask for a tip.

Next the food. I ordered a quarter dark with squash casserole and spicy mac and cheese. I'm fairly certain I received the absolute tiniest piece of chicken imaginable. Look at my picture! That's about a bite and a half of chicken! I saw a kids plate with more chicken! The squash casserole was extremely mushy and could have been eaten with a straw, but it tasted good I guess. I did enjoy the macaroni though, so not all was lost. 

I also feel like I should mention I noticed an employee in the kitchen load up a long rotisserie rod with raw chicken, then rest one end on the floor while waiting. I'm sure the oven gets hot enough to kill anything, but still...

Overall, I give the Roasting Company 2 stars for non-existent service and child-size portions.

I was pleasantly surprised when I finally got over to the Roasting Company one day for lunch.  I had heard about it for years and my mom was always getting it for me when I was sick but I had never actually been inside.  She said the way they seasoned their chicken was perfect for getting over the common cold.  Well she was right, it always did the trick.  So I was thrilled when on a rather healthy-feeling day I went in for a delicious meal of fresh veggies and homemade cake!  The chicken, as always, hit the spot.  There was a cool, funky vibe in there thanks to the young and welcoming staff.  And it was nice to just order at the counter and then kick back in the casual environment and catch up with old friends.
The chicken is good and the sides are always delicious. There's a bar that tends to serve a good variety of beers and stays open late.

A solid 5/5. Phenomenal food in a laid back atmosphere, order at the counter and pick up food when your name is called. The rotisserie chicken is among the best I've ever had and the homemade veggie sides are all great, especially the cinnamon apples and squash casserole. It's hard to go wrong here!
Just good chicken! Counter ordering eliminates the waitstaff and makes this a quick dining option. The greens were very vinegary but I kind of liked them. Great choice for lunch.

The rotisserie chicken was really good. I got the stir-fry veggies and squash casserole for sides and they were tasty as well, although I was expecting something more home made feeling with the casserole. The corn bread was okay, I prefer the square to the muffin types. The soda (Cherry Coke) machine tasted like it needed a calibration, too syrupy. I would certainly return.

Great place and super cheap.  I usually get a side item plate...they have so many great ones to choose from (squash casserole, smoked cheese and pasta, basil green beans, mashed sweet potatoes...)  You can also get rotisserie chicken...just be sure to use the Tico sauce on the table.  Great!!

This place reminds me of a place back in NY..!!  Their rotisserie chicken is PHENOMENAL! Always fresh, always hot!

I came her on a lazy Friday night after work...it was one of those nights where I didn't really want to go out to dinner, but I didn't really want to stay home...when I first walked in it took me a sec to figure out their set up, and how it works, so I just followed the crowd... (Btw, Don't let the exterior look of this place scare you away-it can look a bit "outdated/older")

Once inside, You walk up to a counter, place your order/pay and then wait off to side until they call your name. You can place your order to go, or you can look for a an open table.

I saw that there was two open seats at the bar so I told the young lady that I would be by the bar. I was waiting to here my name be called...but she brought the food on over to me, which was extremely nice of her since she didn't have to do that. 

One of the reasons I decided to actually stay and eat there was that all there draft beer is $3.50 on Fridays. You CANT beat that. They have an AWESOME selection of beers...I just had to stay lol...

We ordered:
Chicken and black bean combo con queso - rice topped with chicken,
black beans and queso. It was delicious! The chicken was pulled right off of the bird, it was hot, tender. juicy....really really good.

1/2 rotisserie chicken dinner with sidesd. Again, the chicken was just PERFECT!

For sides we had white beans au gratin 3/5, squash casserole 5/5, smoked cheese and past salad 5/5, and the collard collard greens 4/5.

This place just reminds me of home. If you want a homestyle cooked meal, without making it yourself, this is the PERFECT place to come to. 

I will definitely be coming back here again. I really enjoyed the food and had really great service.

It's a simple plate of food that can fill you up at the end of a night of great times and good laughs. It's tasty and if they don't have enough flavor there's plenty of house sauces that can help. I would always return. I normally order chicken con queso. With pasta salad and apples. Do you want hand made food or made by hand, trust me there's a difference.

I love the Roasting Company. They fairly recently upgraded the atmosphere and added a bar but the food remains unchanged. Great comfort food.  The 1/4 Chicken and two veggies is a favorite of mine. The squash casserole and cornbread stuffing are both awesome but you cant go wrong with any of their sides including collards, baked beans and more.  My only complain is that they only serve their mac and cheese on Saturdays.

The Roasting Company was our go-to spot when we lived in the neighborhood. It was quick and always delicious. We would often dine in and even more often grab it to go.

Our favorite dishes are the pork over rice and the 1/4 chicken with 2 sides. The sauces are unique and so good! I always get the squash casserole as a side and alternate between the others. I've never been disappointed but some other favorites are the garlic roast potatoes, the pasta salad, the mac n cheese, the baked beans....you get the idea. 

I love that I can eat healthy here. Just get some roast chicken and a couple of veggie sides. 

We will miss having this place nearby but we'll be back.

I love all the food here. The chicken is juicy, flavorful and tender. Squash casserole is delish though I feel like it has more breading in it than it used to a few years back. Monterey Chicken Wrap is so good. This is where I go when I dont want to feel guilty about not making dinner for the family. Feels like a home cooked meal and you can order a balanced plate :)

12 years and still going,  we've loved thus place after being introduced by local friends.   Now we bring new friends here too.   It's changed over the years,  adding a bar,  with lots of local beers on tap.   Just a matter of changing with the customer needs.  Food stays great though and the hot sauces are my husbands favorite (aside from the nuclear wings)  nothing is too hot for him.  My daughter and I love the chicken and black bean combo con queso!   The garlicky new potatoes and stir fry are our sides of choice but they have a pretty assortment to choose from.
I loooove this place. I always have a great time. The staff are absolutely great! The food is amazing! My friends and I love coming here for food or just to hang out. Either way.....great!!!

One of my favorite rotisserie chicken hangouts! The chicken is great, even without the special sauce!  When you walk in you walk up to the counter to order your food. Believe it or not, by the time you get your drinks, utensils...etc, you are being summoned back to the station to get your food!  No time wasted at all!  With the recent changes to the dining room they now have more seating and a great looking bar to hang out at.  You can't leave there without getting the Chicken and cornbread dressing!

Just as it says on the back of the menu, this restaurant food is both nutritious and affordable. What a great concept! But I would add one more thing and say "nutritious", "affordable" and "yummo!" 

I had CHICKEN & BLACK BEAN COMBO W/1 VEGGIE & CORNBREAD and I chose from so many selections "Basil Green Beans" as 1 veggie. I also had a Coke. All under $10. 

This is a great place for a quick but tasty lunch.
I loved the Costa Rican green chili sauce too!
Since I was a little kid, this has been the best chicken I've ever tasted. And the roasted potatoes, chicken tacos and of course the tico sauce are A1...

Went after church today since it was just my wife and myself eating lunch.  Man, I love this place!  The flavors are great! I love the salsa bar with FRESH pico and salsas.  Sides are equally excellent.  Food is simple, but very good.   We ordered takeout, and had enough for lunch, and then leftovers for dinner!  Can't wait to go back!

Ordered from here for some anniversary food (I recently lost my job, so this was the best I could do).

Got teriyaki bbq wings, 1/2 white with smoked cheese and pasta and basil green beans, and 1/2 dark with smoked cheese and pasta and squash casserole. THE WINGS ARE AMAZING; absolutely delicious. I wish that was all I ordered.

My 1/2 white was dry and didn't taste remotely like rotisserie chicken (rotisserie should be perfectly moist all the way through). The smoked cheese and pasta was more like pasta salad than macaroni and cheese (I guess that green stuff in it was spinach), and the basil green beans tasted straight from the can (NO FLAVOR, not even salt and pepper).
The 1/2 dark was the same (dry) and my girlfriend liked the squash casserole (has corn in it), but DID NOT like the smoked cheese and pasta. The cornbread has chunks of corn in it, and I'm not talking about fresh corn (the kind that tastes candied and gets stuck in your teeth easily).

I will only be ordering wings from now on. I might be tempted to get the girlfriend their spicy cheese grits if we ever order on Wednesday.

A charlotte classic! So much so, i probably take it for granted.  A love that they keep it simple, just great food, prepared quickly! 

Hard to find better quality on a daily basis.  Dish and Roasting Company definitely have the best top to bottom options for sides!  You have to try the "squash casserole" at Roasting, it's delicious...even if you aren't a squash fan.

My go to entree is their smothered "Chicken on Rice con Queso" 

They also have daily specials that never disappoint.  Also, A bunch of local beers on tap at the bar.  

Roasting pulls off the trifecta....they are good for a quick in and out lunch, grabbing drinks and snacks with friends or a casual sit down dinner.

What can I say other than this place is a solid, cheap option with late night food in the Montford area.

Oh! I know what else: the chicken will blow your face off. I don't know what they do to it and the sauce, but it rocks harder than Axel Rose high on an ounce of cocaine with 5,000 ten-foot-tall speakers and a subwoofer that runs on plutonium. It's basically a mix of teriyaki and barbeque sauce that you can slather on some pulled chicken and put on a sandwich or serve over rice (Central American style).

There's also beer galore. A few unique ones are on the list, like the locally-produced and hilariously-dubbed Babymaker IPA. Don't get me wrong: we're not talking World of Beer here. But, the list is still substantial and the prices are good: about $5 per sling of a glass of malty bread.

Service by a younger-looking server was attentive and knowledgeable. That matters to me and is a big reason I went with a five star review.

Atmosphere is chill, not really comfortable. But, it's a fun place, so who the fuck cares.

Bottom line, check it out. It is tops.

My husband and I love The Roasting Company.  The food is fantastic, fast, and always served with a smile.  We always sit at the bar because of the hospitality Jake and Danielle give.  They deliver consistent great service that we can count on.  The beer selection is great too.  Jake, the bar manager, always gets in great beers like those from Wooden Robot and Wicked Weed, that are just not found everywhere in Charlotte.  In fact, I don't know that you can get Wooden Robot but 2 places outside of the brewery. 

The Roasting Company is perfect comfort food with a casual vibe and we always feel right at home.  Love this place!

The half chicken with all dark meat is the way to go. The chicken was moist and the cornbread was filling. I went with three sides instead of two and thought it was just the right amount of food for a post workout meal.

You have to go on Tuesday and you have to go early in the afternoon - the special of the day only offered on Tuesday is the quintessential friend buffalo chicken sandwich - arguably the best I've ever had. From the bun to the lightly breaded chicken to what I would say is the definitive buffalo sauce. It's all there. Downside is that hey usually sell out by 2 pm.

While planning my trip I was checking out many of my old favorites, some are gone, many are still flourishing like the Roasting Company. I lived in the neighborhood and would eat here regularly like 2-3 times a week. Imagine my surprise to find they had finally opened the place up and added a full bar and doubled the size of the menu, all to the betterment of their devoted customers.

I was all smiles when I saw that my all time favorite "smoked cheese pasta salad" was still featured, I got an extra order to take back to the hotel. The rotisserie chicken is still the star here, crispy on the outside, juicy and luscious in the inside. All the sides are great, there are 18 to choose from, something for everybody. Free refills, that beautiful classic salsa bar, and and endless supply of hot sauce and their special Tico sauce. The service is always fast, the food is consistently great, I never understood why these guys haven't expanded beyond Montford Drive because this business would thrive anywhere. Also a great place to watch a ballgame now since the expansion. Got a really nice vibe now.

BTW, I was amused at some of the negative reviews. Are you people insane? And BTW, occasionally Yelp does listen cause I flagged one review that raved about the food, but gave the restaurant one star because she had to "refill my own tea" so if you see any of your favorite places being abused like this please flag away, you never know.
2nd time... Chicken n rice w. Collars greens GREAT, but the the baked cinnamin apples were AMAZING!!

Service industry, please keep reading if you want to know how to earn a 1.85$ tip on24$ bill.

Went in for lunch, sat at bar. The lady was rushing the entire time which was off-putting as the place was not crowded at all. Me and my compadre ordered a chicken meals w a side salad. We do not like tomatoes or cucumbers... apparently this is a vital sin at roasting company in plaza midwood while the woman is bartending. After we ordered our food i went to the restroom to wash my hands, on the way out i heard the waitress/bartender bitching about us bc of the way we ordered our salads to the cooks who looked like they didnt give a shit about the trivial order. She proceeded to demean both of us to them as i stood right behind her listening to every word. I did not walk out as I maybe should have... on to the food... chicken and rice was sooooo watery that it slid around on the plate. It was not good. Maybe the food was good but the awkwardness of eating after hearing shit talked about us was too much to bear. As a former restaurant person of many years i get that people can be a holes etc, we were not that at all i promise... i get that workers deal w sht heads and may talk-smack on customers but just dont get caught and when its over salads w out cux and tomatoes chill the f out bc its not a big deal.

Tonight I had their special: Southern BBQ Wrap, and as my side I ordered the Squash Casserole ($8.99) Both were outstanding, and the Southern BBQ Wrap may be my new favorite! I don't always walk away remembering food, but I'll remember that wrap! You must try it!
This was pretty great. I had the chicken and queso with beans and rice. Its was perfect comfort food. I would absolutely eat here again. The garlic potatoes were also delicious.

I've only been here twice, once years ago and then again this past weekend.  We recently moved closer to this area an am sure we will visit often.  At least whenever we need a veggie fix.  Known for their roasted chicken, we both ordered it with different veggies.  The pasta salad was very unique and tasty.  Collards and mac & cheese did not disappoint.

They have changed the place a good bit since I was last here, adding a bar.  The bar was beautiful and a place I wouldn't mind hanging out with friends.

A lot of people passed us with wings, maybe something we'll try next.  It isn't a huge place but there is a good bit of seating still.  You walk up an order then pickup when they call you.  Makes for a quick lunch or dinner.

Enjoy!

Oh Roasting Company, you have been around for as long as I can remember.  Everyone I have ever taken here has always had nothing but good things to say about you.

I always get the con queso or jerk sauce over the roasted chicken and rice and the squash casserole is awesome, need I say more!

For a quick, delicious, cheap (did I say delicious) chicken lunch or dinner in town, look no further than the Roasting Company. Not much decor to speak of, but when all meals come out in under 5 minutes and cost less than $10, fancy decorations are unnecessary. 

My two favorite meals are the chicken and black bean con queso and the half white meat chicken breast. Both are cooked to perfection, and I can get at least two meals out of one order. The corn bread muffins are also very good (be sure to order additional because you'll want more than one - it's worth it at only $0.35 each), and if you go on Saturday, you can get the mac 'n cheese, which has a kick and is my favorite side item offered. The squash casserole and the sweet potatoes are also quite good. 

Ultimately, I recommend the Roasting Company for a quick meal or takeout on those days where you just don't want to cook or need a quick lunch.

So I've been having the occasional lunch at The Roasting company for over 8 years now.  I called in our order today for my office and was again talking to a young guy that sounding like he'd rather be anywhere than on the phone taking my order.  When I told him I wanted to place an order for pickup, he actually said "Oh...  ok, let me get a piece of paper..."  WHAT?  It's 11:15am on a business day and you work at an establishment that makes its money from lunch orders.  Why are you not ready to take an order when you answer the phone?  (And if you're not ready, why do you still have that job??)  Then when I arrive and am simply being mannerly in my conversation, I'm met with silence by the dirty looking guy that's behind the bar.  His hair looks like an oily mess, his pants are hanging off his @ss and he refuses to speak when spoken to?!!??  You do know you're not selling gold bars in this place, right?  I mean- there are tons of other lunch options out there, The Roasting Company isn't all that.  I've SO had it with these entitled millennials half @ss doing their jobs at establishments...  The only thing they're really good at is RUNNING OFF YOUR CUSTOMERS!

Holy Squash Casserole...heaven! My boyfriend loves this place so we went for lunch here on Saturday and I was very impressed. It is priced right and the food is delicious. I also enjoy any place with cherry coke on tap! 

I went with the Tarragon chicken salad on a kaiser roll with garlicky potatoes as my side. My boyfriend had the Monterrey wrap with casserole. My potatoes were ok and sandwich good but the casserole is where it's at! I wish they had it on their menu (it's a special) because I could eat that as my meal alone! 

I'll definitely be back!

The food here needs more seasoning.  Sure the chicken and pork are roasted until it shreds with a fork, but that doesn't compensate for the lack of taste. I'm not a fan of their Jaco sauce which is probably why I'm not a fan.  But their sides are also pretty tasteless too. 

Try it; you might like it...if you're into bland(er) food.

It has been many years since I've been to the Roasting Company down on Park Road, so I luckily remembered that they had this location when we were looking for something different, and glad that we decided to visit.

The new spot is fancy indeed (okay, maybe not white napkin super fancy, but definitely when compared to the old one). It's also nice and open, with a separate bar area, doors that open in nicer weather (though you do have to look over the parking lot), and overall a great space.

Once you do get past that questionable parking lot, the staff is amazing - they will even give you tastes of sides if you are leaning one way or the other, and help you make a decision. Or make your decision a little more difficult, perhaps. The star of the show is, of course, the roasted chicken, so make sure you grab some. One word of warning: If you get a wrap, it can be awfully messy, and due to the aforementioned lack of white napkings, you may not want to go in your Sunday best.

The food here is good, but wasn't exactly what I was expecting. Everything was was good quality and well prepared (and fast!) and the price was very reasonable. My wife and I both ordered the 1/4 rotisserie chicken (white) which came with cornbread and two sides. I got the baked beans and the special: spicy mac & cheese. The first thing I tried was the cornbread, and found it had jalapeños and whole kernels of corn baked in. I know some people really like the whole corn in the cornbread thing, but I'd rather keep my breads and vegetables separate. Next up was the spicy mac & cheese. I love mac & cheese, and I've become a big fan of having a bit of hot sauce added to give it some kick, so I was really excited about this. It certainly had the spicy; it had lots of jalapeños mixed in and was quite hot. What it was lacking was the cheese. There was no creaminess to it at all. The baked beans, however, were very good. They also had jalapeños mixed in (are you sensing a theme here?), but only had a subtle kick which was balanced with a slightly sweet tangy sauce. As for the chicken, the flavor was excellent but most of the breast was pretty dry. The wing, on the other hand, was quite juicy. If you're looking for really moist chicken you might have better luck with the dark meat. There were no jalapeños in the chicken.
The speed in which they deliver your food is always amazing!   Oh yeah, the food is good too.

I was turned on to the roasting company by a colleague and now I'm addicted.  It's truly as good as it gets.  I always get the quarter chicken and it's better than you'll find almost anywhere.  Apples are wonderful too. Everything is served hot the fresh.

There's a reason there's always a line and parking can be hard to find...this place has chicken covered!
Jaco pork taco and white bean gratin are my favorite! Try the tico sauce too!! Yummy!!

I was not blown away with the food at the Roasting Company when I went like many people were it seems. I ordered the chicken and black beans con queso, and it was good but nothing memorable. The chicken was pretty moist and had decent flavor, and was very good with the Tico sauce- which I'll admit is excellent! The black beans and rice were pretty bland and the queso was average as well. I also got a side of green beans that was okay and macaroni salad which was very good. Overall, I'd recommend the mac salad and the tico sauce on chicken but not much else stood out.

Awesome rotisserie chicken and sides. My fave is the squash casserole. No matter how many people rave about the jaco sauce and how many times I've tried to like it, I just can't. It's super overpowering and sweet and when it came with my chicken and rice dish, it felt like the whole dish was drenched in it, making it more like a soup.  That aside, everything else I've had has been awesome.

I'm pretty sure I love every single side item in this place. That's right, I'm the girl who goes to the bangin' chicken place and orders all the sides. 

The Roasting Company is one of those places that just feels comfortable. The food is great and the vibe is laid back. You'll see a line at lunch time. Don't worry, it moves pretty quickly. They crank out some food here. 

I always get a vegetable plate of some sort. The smoked cheese and pasta salad is one of the best sides you'll find in Charlotte. I switch up my other choices based on my current modd. The white beans au gratin, basil green beans, squash- it's all good. I'll stop before I basically just list their entire side item menu. The chicken con queso is delicious. They also have different daily specials. Wednesday is chicken pot pie day. I recommend getting there early because they sometimes run out. 

They have a ton of local beers. The Tico sauce- I don't really know what it is, but it's freaking delicious. I put it on everything. There's also a location in Rock Hill and they're opening one in Plaza Midwood. Happy dance. 

As if you need any other reason to come here, Luke Kuechly ate here the week before every game last season. The only week he missed- the one regular season game we lost against Atlanta.

This is such a fantastic addition to Plaza Midwood. 

I have always been a big Roasting Company fan. I think their Smoked Cheese and Pasta Salad is one of the best side items you will find in Charlotte. This is also a place that has sneaky good queso. I like a lot of things on this menu. Pending on my mood, my go-to orders bounce around between the side item plate (comes with yummy cornbread), chili taco platter, the con queso dishes, and the specials. Bring a friend(s) so you can start with nachos or chips and queso. They have different specials each day (food and drink). Of note: chicken pot pie on Wednesdays (go early they sometimes run out) and chicken and dumplings on Thursdays. Vegetarians, they might be a chicken place, but they have a ton of options for you guys as well. Their Tico Sauce is also delicious.
