I like that there is a patio type area with a TV (it's technically in the building, but they open the doors). They also have a great bar. Note: when you walk in, you can sit at the bar or walk back to the counter and order, then sit wherever you want. This location is open til midnight on Sunday-Tuesday and 2am Wednesday-Saturday.

I was entirely disappointed. I've heard such good things.. i had the buffalo chicken wrap with a side of mac n cheese. The buffalo wrap was fairly bland, very liquid-y and a mess. My husband had the chicken plate with rice and both didn't have a lot of flavor. I would recommend 10 times over the place around the corner.. sorry i will not be returning. Although the atmosphere and ppl working there were pleasant.

As a vegetarian, I was pleasantly blown away by my recent visit to the Roasting Company! I thought I'd walk in after my yoga class just to check it out, but ended up staying for an outstanding meal considering the quality and the price point.

A three veggie plate + cornbread is only $5. That's right, FIVE DOLLARS. I can't remember the last time I got a meal in Charlotte for $5. My most recent trip to Bojangles cost more than that.

And guys, the food was GOOD. Mashed sweet potatoes were on point, not overly sweet and greasy like some diners in town. They also had a white bean stew on special which had really good flavor and warmed me up on a cold day. The King of the Plate though was definitely the cornbread - I'd just eat a plate of that for lunch if they let me.

Really impressed that a restaurant called "Roasting Company" had so many great vegetarian options. Additional shoutout for being gluten-aware and offering lots of gluten-free options.

Meh...

It wasn't bad or good.  I ventured here since it is close to my place of work, and I didn't feel like driving to my favorite Rotisserie Chicken restaurant in Dilworth (which also gets great reviews).  The Jaco sauce was the best part of the meal in my opinion.  Everything else was just OK.  

Next time I won't be so lazy and just drive to where my taste buds lead me.  I would eat there again in a pinch, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Great chicken, be sure to ask for a side of the BBQ sauce (much better than the sauce on the table).  Sides are excellent - try the collard greens and sweet potatoes.  This is a takeout staple for me during the winnter months.

Hit this new location today for lunch.

LOVE this new place and love the new look.   It has a Plaza Midwood feel and some character of the old structure....but looks updated and somewhat rustic.   I liked the vibe a lot.

The set up is great.  BAR in the front.   Food service and Dining in the back. 

The food was just as tasty as the other location.....I believe this will be my new location to attend as the one on Montford is dingy and gross.

I love the food....but what I love most is that you dont have service staff....you take care of yourself and leave when you are done.  

All in all....this new spot is great.   Give it a whirl.
Great food, and friendly staff. Lots of draft beer options if the food isn't enough for you. Homemade sides and delicious chicken all made on site. Highly recommend

This place rocks! First visit this evening and the food was incredible. We had takeout which was packed perfectly for travel. Our selection was a 1/2 Rotisserie Chicken dinner with coleslaw, pasta sald, mashed squash, cornbread stuffing & cornbread. The chicken cooked perfectly juicy with great tasting skin was amazing. All the sides were perfect, but the cornbread stuffing will be coming home every time we eat here. The Staff were so friendly I felt at home. Great location, great food, great people. 5 stars all the way.
I just love this place. So many choices for chicken and my fav is the chicken and rice with tico sauce. Add a side of the tico black beans and you can't go wrong.

So here's the deal. It's maybe 1AM, and a few friends and I coming out of EB discover that they'd opened up a roco in plaza. We were drunk and ecstatic. More ecstatic than drunk, but drunk nonetheless. I expected any subpar food that we could find to be delicious but never in a million years did I expect ROCO to let me down. It was late, and although they were serving food still, they had run out of almost everything. No 1/4 dark meat or white meat. All they had was the pulled white meat. We all ended up ordering the jacko chicken. The chicken was dry, flavorless, lukewarm, and underwhelming, and the jacko sauce was salty and overwhelming. Jacko sauce was nothing more than hoison sauce maybe mixed with soy sauce to make it more salty. It tasted gross on bland chicken. Potatos were cold. The greenbeans were ok. In my drunken stupor I'd rate it a 2 out of 10. If I were sober probably a 0 out of 10. Bartender was very nice, patient, and friendly.

The food here is excellent and affordable comfort food, primarily chicken based. It's a laid-back place and a nice change of pace on Montford. It's a no-frills establishment and you'll be served quickly. My favorite dish is the chicken nachos. I definitely recommend heading here if you want a good, tasty, quick meal.

Awesome... awesome..... awesome!  Fantastic chicken, great sides!   The food is awesome and fast.  Lots of great local beers on tap! 
It's even open late!

This was a excellent choice. My food was delivered nice and hot , and ahead of time  ! I love this place being that I'm a vegetarian they have excellent choice of veggies that are delish! Will be ordering again
Chicken was very tender, nice size pieces, collards and apples were tasty as well. Only giving 4 stars as they should have their own signature sauce! Will absolutely be back.

My favorite restaurant in Charlotte. A staple of Montford Dr. Best chicken in town. Legendary sides. Great bar area now. Quick. Priced right. Try the 1/4 white. Smoked cheese and pasta. Side salad. Can't go wrong.

Very good, cheap food. 

Lunch (12pm) was crowwwd-ed, no tables and a line out the door, so we ended up getting stuff to go. They have the take-out system down, with little containers lining the salsa bar so you can grab whatever you'd like to pile onto your tacos or whatever.  Interesting variety of flavor here, ranging from tex mex (medium salsa) to cumin-y mexican (jaco). The unsalted heat of the pico was rad. There were even little packets of malt vinegar. Dude.

The collards were the highlight for me. Deeply smoky, bitter and tart, and just salty enough. Wolfed 'em down. Squash casserole was meh, but other sides, and the 3 pound veggie wrap, were all delicious and unique.

I whine about this area being an annoying drive from where we live, but there's so much awesomeness here, might be time to park an RV somewhere clandestine and have a weekend pad in this cool little area of "south park". Or just quit whining and deal.

This place was a great place for lunch on Sunday.  My friend and I stopped here to grab a quick bite to each before we headed back to Columbia.  Overall, the place was very good.  The chicken tasted delicious...perfectly cooked and seasoned great.  My only complaint was that I would like to have a bit more skin.   the cornbread dressing was great and the baked beans, best ever!  My friend got the pulled porked over rice.  He said it was very good as well.  They also have a decent sized bar with a good selection of local brews as well. The price was under $10 for a 1/4 chicken, 2 sides, 3 pieces of corn bread and sweet tea.  Wait time was under 5 minutes, very fast!
Chicken is awesomely tender, beer selection is stellar but you come here for the sides. The squash casserole and smoke cheese pasta salad are a revelation. No leftovers tonight.
My buffalo chicken wrap was amazing and affordable. The bartender was very helpful and nice. Definitely want to try more off the menu

This is my go-to lunch place where my office is located.  Their lunch is always fast and fresh.  A plethora of veggies to choose from and fresh rotisserie chicken!  In and out in under 30 min with a fresh and healthy lunch...that's winning in my book.

I've been to this place about 3 times at different times of the day..... They're consistently on point! I sat beside I guy that says he's been going for over 20 years!! Prices are very affordable and they pack the plates!! Check it out don't be lame

We tried RoCo tonight for the first time and it was fine. We live on the other side of town and I wouldn't make a special trip just to visit here. The positive is that we had dinner for 2 and a OMB Copper for $23.75, the stir fry veggies and the corn bread. I love veggies but the green beans had a flavor to them that I didn't care for. My husband enjoyed the garlic roasted potatoes. I sampled his and will say that they are VERY VERY garlicky. He had the chicken and rice and liked it well enough. I had the quarter white meat. I guess with all the fantastic reviews, my expectations were a little too high. I didn't feel like it had any different flavor than a Costco rotisserie chicken that I can buy for $4.99. I just wasn't feeling it.

OMG I love this place. The smoked gouda pasta I come here for that mainly as well as the squash casserole. I love the chicken as well as the chicken pot pie and chicken and dumplings. If I could eat here everyday for lunch I would. unfortunately it take to long for me to get there for lunch as often as I would like. they have opened a second location though which is a bonus.

You guys know they have a new location on Eastway and the plaza. more space and still the same good food. I love the smoke gouda pasta and the rotisserie chicken. they tell me chicken pot pie day is the busiest because they are so good and the pie is huge. all the side items are good especially the squash casserole.

I ordered wings and veggies to go.  They were fast and ready when I got there.  The wings are very good, big and meaty.  The evil wings (Hotter than regular wings) were great, but I was expecting hotter.   I will go back =)

I had never been to The Roasting Company and am a fan of roasted chicken, so I was excited when this location opened up closer to our house. We went on a recent weeknight and each ordered a half chicken with two sides to give us dinner and lunch for the next day. The employee who we placed our order with was super friendly and helpful. He recommended that I order their most popular sides: garlic potatoes and squash casserole. My husband ordered rice and collards.

The food came out pretty quick and was fresh. The chicken was aaaaaaamazing. Fall off of the bone delicious! I loved the garlic potatoes and the little corn bread muffin. While the squash casserole may be popular, I wasn't a fan of it. It tasted more like cornbread stuffing with a little bit of squash in it. My husband wasn't overly wowed by the rice or collards. But really, we were there for chicken and we will definitely be back for the chicken.

Don't  get me wrong - the food here was DELICIOUS - I got the chicken and black bean combo with squash casserole (recommended by my friend Hannah) and lima beans (a special veggie that day).  And the service was fast.  

It's just the personalities that I had a problem with.  I hate it when staff at places like to "joke" with you and tell you that they're out of something or can't do it.  See my review for Chicago q on how staff should act.  That's all. 

Oh, another good thing is that they had fruit punch in their fountain machine... That was fun too.

Ventured to the Roasting Company after being guided here by coworkers.

Atmosphere - Dive-y, old, been here forever feel, busy, rickety table & chairs, diner-esque.

Food - opted for the chicken & black bean combo platter w/ sweet potato mash and corn bread.  The meal is basically pulled chicken on a bed of rice that is drizzled w/ a, black in color, barbeque soy tasting sauce called Jaco sauce.  The flavor was okay but too salty soy for my liking.  The sweet potato mash was dark in color and kind of bland in taste.  The corn bread was just okay.

Service - Yep, at ordering you kind of feel obligated/ guilt-ed into tipping when basically you do all the work w/ the exception of clearing the table.  I would rather leave cash for the table cleaners on the table and not tip on the credit card receipt.  That way I know that they would truly get the tip.   

Overall - It was just okay...nothing great.  I may give them another try if in the area but I would not go out of my way to stop here.

I see the cause for the mixed reviews. Hard to get bar service when there's no empty seats at the bar. I appreciate how after 10 minutes of sitting there no one at least came over. Even though I didn't get to see the manager I see all the reviews about the poor management. First time here, and the last. Get yourself a staff that cares.

Chicken Pot Pie Wednesdays... How I love thee!!!  I have only been here on Wednesdays and it's the only day that they serve up the Chicken Pot Pie meant for the Gods.  They only make a certain number for the day but if you get there before 12:30pm, then you should be fine.  It really starts getting crowded after 12pm.  The Pot Pie is large and you really concentrate hard if you want to finish it in one sitting.  There is no shame with taking the rest home and saving it for late night grub.  Still good!!  Also, definitely try the green sauce on the table.  Mmmmmm mmmm.

Although I haven't tried the other food there (BBQ Homestyle), I've only heard the best things.  So give it all a try.  But honestly, 5 stars for the Pot Pie.  Enjoy!

-Ian M.

3.99 or is it 4.99 - either way you can get a very affordable vegetable plate at this spot and I for one am absolutely loving it! Most places charge about double for the same food, so why not get a filling meal for under $5? Had their collards, squash casserole, and potato salad for dinner tonight and it was pretty decent for what it was. Probably wouldn't order the squash again - tasted way too sweet or the potato salad - nothing was dill like about that said (or maybe I've spent too much time around Russians), but again for the price point I can't be too critical. Decent food for a very fair price and the ambiance is super casual and laid back. Perfect place to grab a beer with a colleague or get a quick bite with a friend. I'll have to try their chicken next time.

I often pick up an order to go and it is always ready in a very short amount of time.  I LOVE the rotisserie chicken salad.  It's huge and always a ton of meat piled on top.  The roasting company is consistent and always delicious!
This is just a cool place. Comfort food is my favorite and I love how I can basically order a thanksgiving meal in the middle of summer if I wanted to.

The Roasting Company's most endearing thing to me (being that I am a night shifter) is the late hours all week. On several occasions my boyfriend and I have gone late at night when we're finally ready to eat or have had late work meetings and can't grab dinner until 1030. With that being said, every time I have been in it is super chill with a small (and mostly quiet) group of people inside. There are plenty of beer options, we always sit at the bar since it's always late, and have never had any problems with service. The portions are huge for what you pay, you won't leave hungry. The food is good, you're not going for five star here, but it is always cooked properly and hits the mark for its cuisine category. I do love the cornbread, it actually has pieces of corn in it, and I normally am not a fan of cornbread. My partner and I at work even grabbed dinner at 1AM the other day, being we work on an ambulance, they were extremely quick to prepare our food--We were very grateful!! Good spot for a casual late night when you're starving and not looking to be fancy.

Very good roasted chicken served as 1/4, 1/2 or whole.  I had 1/4 chicken with Mac n cheese and a tossed salad.  Chicken was hot and tasty, not spicy.  Mac 'n cheese had a little spicy kick that added to the flavor.  Ordered to go and it was ready within 5 minutes. Hot and fresh.  Very reasonably priced and open late.
Adjacent bar had outdoor seating and was very lively.

I alway visit this spot when I'm in Charlotte. This is my go to place when I feel like comfort food. It has a really chill laid back feel that anyone that comes in will be welcomed. I always get the chicken and rice with queso. I also pair it with with cornbread stuffing and green beans. The cornbread stuff is very savory but it's a little heavy on the salt for me. The green beans aren't anything special. I wish they would give them a little love tho. I think they are out of a can from the looks and taste,but hey they are known for the roasted chicken so you know.

Always eat the same thing when I go... two chicken tacos w/black beans. First off, the black beans are AMAZING... good flavor, spicey and vegeterian! I cant get enough of them. The tacos are huge, they put a ton of chicken (almost too much) but they are a little dry... I add the mild and medium salsa and sour cream to mine... I can typically only eat 1 and save the other for later. This was my first time for lunch, typically I get dinner and the place was packed, looooong line. If you are not dining in or have time crunch I suggest ordering ahead.

YASSS. I don't usually eat southern food due to the lack of availability near me, but I love it here. The dark and white meat chicken were both nice and juicy, no dryness in sight. Their cornbread is delicious. I've never had cornbread that had corn in it before. The squash casserole is delicious. I've never had that either. Then again, I don't really eat casseroles.
The atmosphere is very comfortable and the prices are cheap. There's parking all around if you can't find it in their lot.

I was so disappointed. The sides tasted liked they came out of a can, and I bought better roasted chicken at the grocery store. The sweet mashed potatoes looked absolutely DISGUSTING. They were GRAY! Also, they ran out of their special. It was 2 p.m. How could you possibly run out of the special at 2 pm?? I don't recommend this place and I will never go back. It was gross.

Yes, I can be a condiment queen, but I like to be able to play off the flavors that already exist in the dish... at the Roasting Company I feel like they're making me do all the work. 

I get the appeal, I understand why this is a favorite of many friends, but it just isn't for me. (Clearly plenty feel they're doing something right if they're continually busy at standard meal times.) Either my sandwich is so loaded with meat and liquid (calling it sauce would mislead you to thinking it has a taste) it disintegrates faster than I can chew, or I feel like I just ate a plate of bland, watered down... what did I order? Luckily, there is a salsa bar and the tico sauce, but I want my pork to be able to contribute SOMETHING to my lettuce and tomato on tortilla. 

I will admit, some of the sides are tasty. But with the options in town for rotisserie chicken and even tacos, this does not fall high on my list. Unlimited refills are nice, service is speedy, and the staff at the counter is friendly.

A co-worker picked this place and boy am I gald she did.  I ordered the evil wings and the roasted vegetables.  My co-worker got the roasted chicken.  All the food was very good.  I also got a side of the Nuclear sauce.  Wow was that good!  I will get the nuclear wings next trip even though the evil sauce was really good too.

The best thing about the evil sauce is that its different.
After the great reviews I expected something... good. Instead I was completely underwhelmed. So-so to gross ingredients, edible but barely. Will not be going back here.

Yes, I have continued to give The Roasting Company, year after year, a try because of the talk and good reviews. However, unfortunately I do not get it. From the service to the food, everything is a let down in my mind.
Last night, almost a year after my last review, I decided to try them again for their so called "great" chicken and dumplings. Okay, if you like mushy dumplings with no flavor this dish is for you. Blah, wouldn't order again.
It comes with one side and cornbread. Cornbread was hard as a rock and cold, ugh! However I will say the mixed veggies were pretty good. But, honestly, how badly can you mess up stir frying veggies?

So, with this final review I am going to pass on this place, too many great restaurants out there with some of the same food options.

I was extremely excited about eating here but my food tasted like they threw it in the microwave & warmed it up.. not freshly made AT ALLLL... my bf had honey hot wings & they were the absolute top 5 wings I've had in my life! Maybe they were in a rush but I was so upset
This place is so good it made me rethink leaving the restaurant industry. I've had the chicken pot pie (wed special) a half chicken and the squash casserole. Very delicious indeed!

Roasting Company to me is like a Boston Market substitute (gasp!!!).  It's not that it's not good, but I just like Boston's chicken a little better because it's seasoned a little better.  But since Roasting Co. is close to work, it is a nice alternative when I plain refuse to go to yet another fast food joint.  

The food is fast, consistently decent and relatively cheap.  I normally get the quarter dark, but today I decided to get a half dark (which is only $1.53 more) and now I have leftover for another meal... much more economical :)  Seasoned corn was a little disappointing for it's not seasoned much.  Squash casserole was ok, not super cheesy so I feel like I was being semi-healthy.  Overall the veggies were both little too blend for my taste.  

It's a solid place for lunch, especially they have a few outdoor tables so we can also get a dose of Vitamin D on a sunny day.
My favorite chicken place in Charlotte since the early '90s. EVERYTHING is great and the Jaco sauce is the bomb. Chicken and black bean combo is my all time fav.

It's been 15 years or so since the last time I ate here; i.e., pre-marriage, children, etc. However, it was a bit nostalgic to come back with wife and family in tow. While the vibe is a bit different, they have given the building a facelift and added a brew pub, the food taste and quality is just as I remember. Reasonably priced family food is not always easily found, so I was pleased. I don't know the next time I'll be back, but would definitely come around again the next time I'm in the area.

Not a typical rotisserie.  I was expecting some else before walking into the Roasting Company, but I was pleasantly surprised in my findings.  

Two options for ordering when we went their for lunch.  Either order at the standard chowline formation, or you can place a order at the bar too.    This would be a great place for group outings as people can order and pay separately with ease.

I got the chicken wrap and it was delicious.  FYI it was more of burrito than a wrap. Also, you should make sure to try the Costa Rica sauce that is offer by the salsa bar.

I'll start by saying I frown on animal abuse, but I'd be lyin' if I said I wasn't glad someone killed all those chickens and let Roasting Company cook 'em up for me. This is the best restaurant under $20 in the city. I want an iv of Tico Sauce hooked up to me. Will it kill me? Probably. Don't care though. 

Overall: A+

In the couple of years since I last visited, the Roasting Company has added a "taproom" area where they have table service AND BEER. I had no idea!

The chicken is still absolutely great. Moist and tasty. I'd recommend the chicken and black bean con queso. Or one of the chicken pot pies if they haven't sold out. Add a scoop of salsa (mild, hot or very hot) from their salsa bar.

Other than the beer menu (and spirits too), there is a Coke fountain and urns of sweet/unsweet tea.

Viva The Roasting Company!  This place has a great Costa Rica chicken rotisserie style food. It's also located in the heart of the ever popular Montford Drive. And there is even a private parking lot for this place - imagine that!  

The food is mainly chicken, and I usually go for the quarter white meal which comes with two of their great sides. Try the cinnamon apples as one of them - you won't be disappointed. And it's like having dessert. I also recently tried their chicken salad sandwich and thought the chicken salad itself was done really really well. Oh and Wednesday's are chicken pot pie days - rather large ones too.

Inside the place has been remodeled and expanded. They now have a large bar which makes for a great evening scene and will keep them in business even longer. I prefer to sit in one of the tall booths. They make you feel like you and your compadres are dining in a private room. There are also some swanky high top tables as well.

So if you are a carnivore, go check out this great chicken restaurant!

Where else can you pick from a full menu that has chicken con queso, rotisserie chicken, and vegetarian dishes at 12am? That would be the Roasting Company. I come here about once a week and the food is to die for. I love the squash casserole and the smoked pasta salad. Haven't had any other sides really because I've fallen in love with those two. But PLEASE get the chicken con queso. It will change your life. For real for real.

Also, if you go around 5 or 6pm, prepare to wait if you don't call in your order. It's not a bad wait, but it's just a lot better to call in. You may hold, but the staff is VERY courteous and they will make sure you're taken care of.

And you get cornbread with every entree.. And cornbread is amazing.

Oh! And the bartender who is regularly there is awesome. Very knowledgable about beer, wine, and the food menu. So grab a drink and chat with him!

I wanted to like this place but there was just something about the meal I had that just was not right.  Maybe it was my fault to get the dish that had almost every ingredient in it.  I will certainly try them again and hope for the best.

Great place ! Great atmosphere! It's already my second time here and I'm sure coming back !
The staff is very nice and it's always full of people ! Its very recommended to come here on the weekend .

Am I missing something here? I just do not find that their food is very flavorful. 

The vibe and decor are pretty cool. We came here to meet some friends for beer specials (which are apparently very reasonable on Fridays) and shared a plate of nachos. Decently sized, but we had to put a lot of cholula and their habanero sauce on the chicken to give it some sort of taste. 

Not my favorite, but that's okay since Viva Chicken opened up just a little ways down Park Road.

Have been going here for years and am never let down. The roasted chicken is the best I've ever had. Their chicken, rice and black beans dish is amazing. I don't know what's better, the chicken or the side dishes. Their roasted potatoes are great, sweet potatoes are amazing. The corn bread is the absolute best. If you feel like good comfort food, this is the place to go.

Yum. Yum. Yum. From the delicious, fall-off-the-bone chicken, to the random chicken + something delicious + something else delicious combos, you can't go wrong with anything at The Roasting Company. The sides are all great, especially the spicy mac and cheese on Saturdays and the corn muffins that come with are scrumptious and have corn and green chilies in them. And while the food is always great, the service is always spectacular as well! Everyone who works there must be constantly eating the food because they are ALL so happy! Their to-go option is great too. Call it in and scoot directly to the front of the line to pick it up. And, while this might sound trivial, the food is packaged up well so you don't have any crazy spills on the way home.

I used to think more highly of the Roasting Company but a few recent visits left me wanting a little bit more flavor or tenderness with my chicken.  Perhaps my tastes have changed in my old age.  Anything is possible.

Anyway, RC excels in their side items with many having a southern twist to them including mashed sweet potatoes, collards, etc.  For meals they feature tex mex items like burritos and then they also have rotisserie chicken.  

They have a small salsa bar and a few sauces on the table.,  The hot sauce has a nice smokey flavor to it and goes well with anything you put it on.

The restaurant can get very busy at peak times so you may have to wait until at table is cleared before you sit down.

Been 4 times. First time, the bar and food were great. Chicken, beans, rice, sides delicious, big portions. 

2nd visit, bartender was very rude and treated us poorly. Actually, the manager was awesome about it and he got us to come in 3rd time. 

3rd time, food was good... But not great. Pork, rice, pasta salad (yum). It is all, however, just a bit bland (this coming from someone who hates added salt). 

4th time, last straw... You lost me. Come to dinner at 630pm. Out of Buffalo chicken sandwich special. How in the world does that happen? I wound up finishing my beer and heading to kickstand to get a real, live, Buffalo chicken in the wild. 

It's 50/50 at this point. I am, unfortunately, out. Too many other consistent spots.  I know management cares, but consistency is a BIG problem.

The cute bartender from Boston convinced me to have a cider...I never order cider.  It was refreshing nevertheless.  The atmosphere in this sports bar/ restaurant was chill.  I'd certainly come back in here to try the food out and sit at the very expansive bar area.  They've also got some good family/group seating space for you to come and get comfortable.  There's a lot of brews available on tap; what more can you ask for?  The bartender, aside from my vane reason earlier was very friendly and nice to chat with. Everyone seemed to be a fan of her.  I liked this place; the location just kind of threw me off initially as it was located in a strip mall. Nice place nevertheless.

I am astonished! When in walked up I thought this experience would be boring but quite the opposite.   

My taste budswere thrown for a loop! What the heck is in the squash casserole? Delicious! And how about their own "Tico Sauce" made and sold right here on location.  A very interesting blend of spices inspired by Costa Rica.  Very nice!

I shall be Back!
The Roasting Company is delicious which is why it's been around for so long. They offer so many great sides and let you know which items are gluten free!

On a quick trip in Charlotte and RoCo was recommended by friends.  It is on Montford Street with lots of other good looking places.  I wasn't exactly sure of the ordering process when I stepped into the restaurant but quickly figured it out and went to the window on the right.  My buddies suggested I go with the chicken and queso.  I threw in the black beans too for the "queso combo."  For my sides I got the oft-mentioned squash casserole and cole slaw.

The chicken, queso, and black beans was really good.  All of the flavors blended well but you could still taste each individual component.  I actually really liked the slaw too.  It was more tangy than sweet as some cole slaw can be.  I didn't love the squash casserole as much as others have but I thought it was good.

The woman who took my order was very nice.  Don't go in here looking for decor.  These folks focus on the food and do that well.

I look forward to trying more think from RoCo on future visits.
